ekZFi9p22Xqxd8h5N6Dxpg.text: Found out about this place last month and have already been here a handful of times. Super cute and modern place with lots of space and it's kid friendly !   Now the food is bomb! The breakfast burrito is delicious and whatever they do to those potatoes makes them super crispy on the outside, yet smooth and creamy on the inside!!! Hands down best potatoes this potato addict has tried!   I tried the queen bee late that everyone recommends and it was perfect. I expected it too be overwhelmingly sweet but it was just right ! Try this place and it will instantly be one of your faves !!!!

_0VMumpM04Pech7iUBhovw.text: Neighbors has a nice atmosphere where you pay at the counter and can converse with friends/family for hours without being interrupted. The food came out very quick and the staff at the counter were very friendly.

uBU17GSuq5I9xmJz1oPVIg.text: I've eaten here twice. Soooo good! The breakfast burrito bowl was super hearty and delicious. Also loved the sweet beet salad with steak. My husband had the chipotle chicken sandwich from summer menu and still raves about it. He doesn't rave. So it must've been legit. Service is friendly and fast!

8hO4xcxq7Go6oDPdy0aM7g.text: Awesome place to have coffee and/or breakfast! They have a lot of large tables so it's good for big groups too. We ordered the burrito bowl (with turkey sausage substitute), corned beef smash, lavender latte and London fog. Everything tasted amazing! Very nice Scandinavian inspired interior :)

MUABBXDPWpKaBGUvLCUCaQ.text: This place is such a hidden gem! Excellent food and very nice ambiance. Very relaxing and chill place to hang out and eat some amazing food.

uMEDMAbDRmR1EliOlrQdzg.text: Such a great environment and yummy food. Everything is prepared fresh and the staff is very friendly. The pastries look huge and delicious. You have to try their Kale and Cauliflower soup. It doesn't look appetizing when they serve it but OMG!!!! It's do delicious!!

WP96yB8ip3DP04sOEFplpQ.text: Burgers here are solid.  Whenever I order delivery from this place (Grubhub for work)  the burger arrives well made, tasty, and still warm.

W5ZbHtWOYKkWs1PoBYdy0A.text: Wow, I hate to be a party pooper here, but I was really disappointed in this place.  It was Father's Day and my Hubby and I found ourselves on the other side of town in search of brunch. I opened my trusty Yelp app and came across Neighbors. I saw all of the great reviews and thought it sounded great, so we headed in.   I dig the idea of this place - fast casual, order at a counter, open seating, etc. The food sounded good too so I was excited. I ordered the steak and eggs, which is and 8oz ribeye with housemade chimichurri, smashed potatoes and eggs. My hubby ordered the breakfast burrito, which he really enjoyed. I ordered an iced chai and he asked for black coffee and then we ordered the frittata for our daughter with an extra side of potatoes. We were given a number and found a seat, but weren't really given any instructions other than where we could find a high chair.  We took a seat and a few minutes later my latte was delivered. We mentioned to the server that we also ordered a black coffee and he pointed to a self serve station near the register (this would've been nice to know).  Our food was delivered and everything looked amazing! That is, until I cut into my steak. It was way undercooked - to the point where I was almost afraid to eat it. My Husband felt horrible and told me to send it back. I probably should have, but I ate what I could and enjoyed the potatoes and eggs and then just gave up. Nobody ever really checked to see if we were satisfied, so I also didn't have the opportunity to say anything and I didn't really want to wait forever for my meal to be remade.  Our breakfast (after adding a tip, which I don't think we should've done) was almost $60, which is more than we would spend at a traditional sit-down place. This just adds to my disappointment, since we had to get our own silverware, fill our own waters and coffee and my meal was not cooked properly. As I mentioned, my husband loved his burrito, but that is not enough for us to return. Although everyone we encountered was friendly, nobody ever checked back to ensure that we were satisfied with our food and that is unfortunate. Maybe I am being way too hard here, but I just didn't have the mind blowing experience so many others have mentioned.

uodCvzug7PUTsaQH9fEHqA.text: Wanted to love this place, but just wasnt that into it.   Food was ok, the self service I don't understand at all. Seems geared towards millennials by millennials. Service is nonexistent, just ppl working there going about their business and interacting with each other.  I ordered the old school breakfast and salmon toast. And a latte.   Scrambled eggs were folded...booooo Smashed potatoes were delicious  Sausage links were just unusual but tasty  Salmon toast....fail! Glob of salmon with garnishes that are more for looks than taste. Oh and all the delicious coffee reviews, nonsense, even Sbux is better.   This place had the right idea with poor execution. But someone please tell me why places like this still expect tips at the register??? Upfront even. Who am I tipping? I gave you my business and you gave me what I paid for... that requires gratuity??? I think not. At least give me the illusion that you are trying to earn it.

C_Q4qiyQ_Kuh4NeNmbwRbA.text: Really like the food and ambiance here. But the food runners need to wash their hands. Multiple times I witnessed a food runner touching his face or hair and then delivering food. Or bussing a table and not wiping it. Not ok. And because of that, I can't go back. Too much of a germophobe.

ErzMEU47yOSvFa_NL-WcKQ.text: Food was good, however I'm giving this place 3 star because the customer service was absolutely terrible. I was barely acknowledged. I had to go get my own napkin and utensils. I was ignored when I called on the 2 "waiters" there. Not friendly at all. Wouldn't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey feta burger sweet potato fries and a cold brew

tZ7kuIIuKi_SvOMSFp-oeg.text: Order the turkey burger with sweet potato fries. It has a Mediterranean vibe. I loved it and can't wait to go back. This spot is super cute, inviting and the staff is welcoming and always smiling!

jzUDArs0y07fLx-SIf9_6w.text: This is 1 out 2 of my favorite brunch spots in Las Vegas. I love everything on this menu! A little pricey, but well worth it IMO. Really love the Rise and Shine Acai bowl and the Avo Toast here. Breakfast sandwich is really good as well! As far as drinks I always get the mocha with coconut milk. Please try this place you will love it!

4Wrbvi3uF3Z2BjMIexfg1A.text: If you could pick your neighbors, mine certainly would all be like this! This is not a new spot in the southwest area of Las Vegas but it is to me. Thanks to my son, I got introduced to this fabulous place! The food is always fresh and the menu is very expansive! I am currently working my way through the menu to try everything they have because everything they do have is so delicious and fabulous! It's always very fresh and creative! I highly recommend you try this place! Whether you want to eat breakfast or lunch, or just mix it up. Five stars for the menu selections, for the service and for the venue itself. This trip we had both breakfast and lunch. Their homemade soups are excellent, especially the pea soup and can't say enough about the fresh ingredients! So many in-house made teas and juices, etc. it's such a cute little place as well and always clean and the staff is always so friendly and helpful. Just go! Delish!

pRUZ1ysNKok2sUT-1YLvDQ.text: YUM. Neighbors never disappoints. I always get either the iced London Fog or an iced Matcha. The London Fog tastes a bit water down due to the ice but the hot always has a more pungent lavender flavor. It's just too hot outside for that right now.   In the past I have ordered the avocado toast for breakfast. Damn, it is SO GOOD. I got that with a latte and they did a cute design in the foam.   I shared a B.L.A.T.C (Bacon, Lettuce, Avocado , Tomato, Chicken) with my mom. We also got a side of sweet potato fries. The sandwich was pretty standard but what made it stand out was the pesto aioli that left it with a smooth and nutty flavor. If you have a pesto allergy, get it with the avocado crema (it tastes just as good!)  The sweet potato fries were crispy, salty, and satisfying. I couldn't stop eating them!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7OgtnQ4qlAvaw7Mk9gaFIQ.text: What a lovely coffee shop/ cafe! Located in the southwest area on sunset and ft Apache. Decor consisted of plants & succulents, super cute vibe. This place is self-seating. Ordered the matcha latte as well as the classic breakfast (so sorry, forgot what it's called.. but I'm basic so it consisted of eggs, bacon, potatoes, and bread) and as basic as it is.. it can still go so wrong but this place got it so right!!! They offer other styles of coffee drinks, tea, and brunch items. Great ambience to get together with your friends or family

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DO2Af9ozs2SRwCIbVk_gQQ.text: Ate there for the first time today and loved it!! Healthy, quick and flavors are not compromised! I am a  vegetarian foodie and was so pleased with the options for me as well as the non-dairy milk options! I'll definitely be back

laST0uParQZNAdrCJt0bsg.text: Very cute hipster brunch cafe in the area that definitely elevates American comfort food. They have a smaller menu but what they have on the menu will blow your taste buds way. I definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area to try some delicious food.  The cafe was very open and spacious. The decor was very minimal but was very green because of all the surrounding plants they had in the vicinity. You order at the counter and they'll give you a little stand with your name on it where you're able to pick any table of your choosing.   I got the breakfast burrito and was amazing. Inside the burrito was lightly smashed potatoes, sausage and eggs and on the side was a chipotle ranch sauce which really enhanced the flavor of the potatoes and sausages very well.  My only complaint is that it can get pretty heavy and that they only sprinkle the pico de gallo on top and on the plate for decoration. If you need something to cut through the heaviness ask for more pico de gallo/salsa.  I had a taste of my friend's french toast and it was amazing. Super soft and pillowy, and  generous on the cinnamon but it's not overwhelmingly sweet.   The portions at Neighbors is very generous as well so you won't have to worry about small portions if you're coming in starving!

jf0apjLFEYx0K0DRo2V9Pg.text: Food was good and prices are reasonable, but the service is not that great when you need to get up and get your own utensils and napkins.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CsE7l7VTTDLCdBwTHB0VGA.text: Great location...great food. We love the concept however the day we went it was SO very loud. Difficult to enjoy a conversation. Staff was lovely and the menus options were unique and healthy.

fGfQJF4dJGdzW5lQfGA_Tg.text: Unfortunately, these neighbors aren't my type of neighbors. We came here this morning with the family and spent more than $80 for breakfast and coffee. The items I tried: coconut pancakes, avocado toast, breakfast sandwich and the fall pumpkin latte with coconut milk. Let me just tell you that it was wayyyy overpriced and for the taste, definitely not worth it. The breakfast sandwich and pancakes were ok, but the avocado toast was not good. It seemed like they used store bought guacamole on the toast. We told one of the employees we didn't like it and took it back and asked if we wanted anything else and so I asked for the raspberry white chocolate muffin to go. Honestly, the muffin wasn't that great either. Highly disappointed. I guess I won't be driving down this neighborhood in the future.

0HoE_IaXPh5Wm6wpfMpEAQ.text: This is the type of place you order at the counter, go find a table, wait for your food to be bought out.  Cute spot, but SUPER LOUD!  You have to yell or talk very loudly to hear each other at the same table.  It gives me the LA vibe here.  Great place for IG people to post what they're eating.  Busy, but not too bad.  There were 2 tables opened after we ordered our food.   Service, semi ok.  It was our first time here and nothing was special.  No one greets you when you come in or even noticed when you're looking for assists.  They didn't explain how things work.  Example, where the napkins and utensils were kept.  They were actually out of clean forks.  It would have been nice when the guy who dropped off our food would mention it to us.  It's obvious they weren't on our table.  The cashier didn't tell us either.   The food was ok, not bad.  Nothing I'm craving.  I'll come back another time see what they have.

wpn-tQpQiAeE4mFoOjMu-g.text: This is officially one of my favorite places for breakfast. It is located in the Southwest in a simple structure with a promising inside of spectacular food.  To begin with, the service is friendly and very helpful. The  prices are more than reasonable.  You go to the counter, look at their menu of a large array of choices,and you order and pay the same time. They bring everything to your table which is the table you choose, first come first serve, to sit at with your party. To start, I ordered a London fog lavender tea with almond milk and it was outstanding. I ordered the acai bowl made with fresh bananas and blueberries and oats and coconut and several other delicious additions and it was outstanding. The avocado toast is amazing with a side salad that you put on top as well as a over easy egg placed on top with it. Just delicious. The egg with sausage and toast is delicious as is the burrito. The breakfast sandwich made with eggs and sausage and Gruyere cheese, accompanied by fingerling crisp potatoes, is also delicious. The price is right and this place is absolutely delicious. We are so coming back here and I highly recommend it.

i5kmd5ahCPXtjAz3_Z3fjw.text: Stumbled upon this place while my car was getting serviced, and I am so glad that I did. The food, drinks, and service are all incredible. The menu may be short, but the options are amazing (and mostly vegetarian/vegan friendly!) I got the lavender latte and coconut pancakes. After trying this, I'm positive that I'll be back again! Thanks for a great experience and for the delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte and coconut pancakes. So good!

y9Bh3VEvS2IIGVl88sjZqQ.text: First time here and was not impressed. I had the breakfast sandwich with the house potatoes and a vanilla latte. My food came out quickly but not the coffee. When my coffee arrived after half of my sandwich was gone, there was lipstick on the cup (big turn off), I took it to the counter and they apologize and remade my drink, when I finally got it back, it sure was not worth the wait. The coffee did not have any flavor, very bland and not hot. Also, the toast on my sandwich was soggy and really did not WOW me (lack of flavor) and the potatoes were cold. I guess I ordered the wrong thing given the other reviews.  The overall appearance of the restaurant was nice and inviting with live plants everywhere. The downside was the noise level, given I was there on a Wednesday and just a few other customers, I can't imagine what it sounds like with it's full.  Not sure if I will give them another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ei7A7L6BflvMkXi4uWbPBQ.text: This is a awesome place to start your day; great food, good environment , nice people, very enjoy the plants around here, "steak and eggs" are awesome !!! Fresh Fresh Fresh, love it!

bMrDEqG1sYVNzVffM2gWKA.text: Such a good vibe with GREAT food!! We ordered the French toast and it was nothing short of amazing!! We are definitely coming back.

5k87vk0aS-gtL7CSIPqL9Q.text: Been here several times and my overall impression is good! you can tell they put thought in their food, they are really yummy and I feel it's worth the price, they also offer very good reward program and you get 10~15% off your bill occasionally so it's a big plus.  They are also very environmental friendly, everything's served in glass or ceramic, thank you so much for doing this.  Just couple things result in one star off....I feel they are not flexible on their order, in one of their order, we can pick either bacon or sausage, I ask them if I can do half and half so I know which one is my favorite next time I go, cashier immediately told me they can't do that...(ok....wow, is it really that hard?)   another time I order my meal with bacon, but they gave me sausage instead, I told them I ordered bacon and not sausage, so they took away my order, throw away those sausage and put bacon in it.....I just don't understand, rather than just throw away, why can't you just let your customer keep it(especially restaurant is the one who made the mistake and not the customer), please don't be so stingy, and you also ruin another perfect chance for your customer to try out what you have in your restaurant.  So in the end, I still don't know what their sausage taste like, I don't think I'll ever be able to find out....

zLC54pgseYyTE0X5nvnbcg.text: I love this place. The staff are really friendly.  Not only it's aesthetically pleasing, the food is delicious!

Lost 1 star just because it's painfully loud inside, will probably get food to go next time.   Note: no burrito photo because it was so good I couldn't put it down!

i_oYqojTtQtBGxdAhb9C2Q.text: Came in for the soft opening, really good food and a really cute cafe and great service. Will definitely be back when they open (:

id8MV1doetiAkjkSV31jmQ.text: Probably the best breakfast burrito I've had to date. Servings are huge; I look forward to eating the rest of my burrito for breakfast tomorrow. Will definitely be back here to try their other stuff.

JvLLmRQgGHYYzkfvhERUOQ.text: Nice modern space, but dont go if you want to eat in peace because it can be very loud. Getting to order seemed like it took forever, and i was only 3rd in line.  My husband's bacon burger was excellent, with good quality lettuce, tomato, and red onion. The french fries were just meh. I had the old school brekkie. Eggs were cooked perfectly, but the bacon was almost raw. Gross. I enjoyed the smashed taters and appreciated the bit of greens and tomatoes. The sourdough was nicely toasted but it didn't come with butter, so i asked for some. It was super cold which made it impossible to spread. Bummer.  We didn't try the coffee, but i know they use Vesta. We will come back to try it, and i hope it's as good as downtown's Vesta.

Q98yhJBSWbDsAqxVgYapgA.text: A morning spent at Neighbors is fully a delight. The staff welcomes you with a smile and after taking your order at the counter, gives you a personalized name plaque instead of an impersonal number to identify where to bring your food. My favorite is their take on Avo toast -- a delicious combo of crispy, dense toast with flavorful avocado. The room is filled with plants and feels cheerful and bright.

X--aoP1lKdJ0VaLeRtz1Lw.text: This was a fantastic breakfast stop, super friendly staff. I had the corned beef smash, fresh and delicious. The atmosphere is clean and according to my mom, hipster.

XLABf-4nQUdGVQUxAnZvjg.text: Excellent ambiance and place to get together with friends for coffee. Great customer service. I haven't had any of the sweet bakery items but the frittata and breakfast burrito were just okay.

VNpye60_PA_rWxCKmLndNw.text: THE BEST POTATOES. It's extremely crispy and well seasoned. The workers are also very sweet. Nice photo opportunities & great cinnamon buns :)

8d3chnA9It8P7jAk9eDNcA.text: What a cute little spot!  If I lived closer, I'd be dropping by this place as if they really were my neighbors!   Food is good and fresh, service is friendly and the space is clean and airy. Only problem is the noise level...the acoustics in this place is terrible, so trying to chit chat over coffee or breakfast is almost impossible. The menu options all sound great and they have fun seasonal items as well :)   Super cute plant wall and pretty drinks make this an Instagram brunch spot for sure! Food comes out quickly which is an added plus!   Would definitely come again, maybe when it's not so busy or if I'm just grabbing a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella latte! Yum!
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frittata and sweet potato fries :)

mqtvd3LpmhbJKo8nRCFq7w.text: Whenever I visit Las Vegas, I make it a point to try a different restaurant.  I can always eat at the casinos for free but that too gets boring.    My wife and I decided to make the short drive to visit Neighbors after a recommendation from our friend who was local.  The place is currently at a stand alone spot which is good in terms of parking.  Though it does get busy, there's tons of places to park.  The moment you walk in, you see who popular this place is.  I'm sure the majority of the customers that were in when I visited were locals but I could be wrong.  The smell of coffee was welcoming.  The layout of the dining area is perfect.  It allows rooms for people to eat comfortably, without banging elbows with their dining neighbors.  You order first then pick a place to sit.  Within minutes your food and drink are delivered to you.  There are several table options.  Small for a couple or large for a big group.  The food was really good and all natural.  The breakfast potatoes were surprisingly good too.  The portions are large enough to share if you get a plate.    I'll probably be back again when in town.  Kudos to Neighbors for offering a new place to enjoy brunch.  Give them a try.  You can thank me later.

q5Ilz9g4-dGu6ELuqyTHaw.text: Located in a bit of an unusual location but this place is a gem! I had the portoritto, which was absolutely delicious. Prices are on the high end but you get the proportion you pay for, so it's worth it! The grilled onions and peppers were so flavorful. Definitely coming back to the their avocado toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oIgtT7EYgljx1OOpk4NHiA.text: Very clean,cute, quaint and hipster  vibe in this restaurant. You are surrounded by little succulents and Thomas Edison style bulbs.  The menu is a smaller breakfast and lunch menu but everything looks really good. Even though the menu is small the ingredients were all very thoughtfully crafted together so it was hard to pick. I was stuck between coconut pancakes, breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito. I opted for the sandwich and it was fresh and tasty.  They have a little section with baked goods which all looked delicious. I chose a lemon poppy seed muffin. It was sweet but not too sweet which is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Menu
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Menu
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Front entrance

pnkKZqrCFh1dHO79lzHKjA.text: I am so in love with this place! It's a sneaky little spot and hardly noticeable unless you know what you're looking for. This can be both a good thing and a bad thing. Bad because new customers might not see the storefront (but they will see the sign spinners!) but also good because for now, it's just my little spot that not too many people will flock to! lol.   My boyfriend and I absolutely love the decor inside. Minimalistic, sort of rustic, plants.. it just feels like you're not in Las Vegas. I wish there were outlets here and that they extended the hours because I would love to just study and work here on my laptop! Due to my work schedule I can only come here on the weekend mornings if I'm lucky!   The parking isn't too bad. The food is great, the drinks are great, the whole vibe here is great. I'd recommend this place to all my friends, but I wanna keep it all to myself ;)

iGHN3WELvOrDEfDisf35-A.text: Quick brunch before our flight back home & I'm glad we got to try THIS place out. I'm all about presentation & this place just blew me away. Its so cute! The interior caught my attention! We walked in & there was already someone waiting to give each of us a menu. Take a seat & order upfront at the register when you're ready.   They offer a few breakfast dishes & different burgers/sandwiches. I played it safe & got a mushroom burger but I'm glad I did because it wasn't like any other mushroom burger I've tried. Very flavorful & the FRIES were thin & crispy just how I like it! Perfect place for caffeine lovers. I requested for something sweet & the guy suggested a plain old vanilla latte, but it was anything but that. It was actually pretty good!   Wish I could say i'll be back soon, but maybe on our next vacation to Vegas this will be on my list of places to return to!

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FG2woyE6Yx7HRS98ZwioWA.text: Really liked this spot...the food and coffee AWESOME  Extremely clean place...the only complain was the way the food is ordered and served  Sorry I'm use to waiters taking our order and serving us including checking up on us...especially if you are looking for a tip at beginning...if I knew I would have put 10% instead of 18% to 25%  Sorry just dropped off food and then ...u are on your own I would at least put someone besides  cleaning tables  Put someone to bring refill waters and drinks and bring utensils to each customer. I know it's the new way of restaurant service but tipping and service go hand in hand fyi But was fresh and good

dCs3uFuPSBhxisy2GWj_7Q.text: If you're looking for a healthy, fun, outdoor vibe, this is the place for you! I thought the environment and the atmosphere of the venue was absolutely amazing and defiantly was decorated very hip, urban, and cute.  The coffee was amazing! The coffee surpassed the food in flavor for me for sure. The food I thought was good, I got the avo toast, I have had better avocado toast from other places but this was defiantly up there! I will be going back for sure for the coffee!

eOuyenYzynrDQdA41ZSGlg.text: This is a cute farm to table brunch place. We stopped by on Mothers Day after church and it was a great spot close to the church. My sister got 2-egg breakfast with turkey sausage and I wanted the beet salad with soup of the day (pea soup) and side of scrambled eggs. The food was fresh and I enjoyed it along with our two espresso drinks. They gave us a complimentary slice of cherry cheesecake and it tasted fresh and homemade. I definitely recommend this neighborhood spot!

6OloDE864Ofbkl0tbPz8ng.text: Right when you walk in the place is cute and screams HIPSTER w/ the succulents on the tables and the overall look of the place but we never judge a place based on appearances, well not solely.  Walked up to the register and I ordered my coconut pancakes and matcha latte, the hubs ordered some breakfast wrap. They give you a sign with your name on it and you find a place to sit. Most of the tables are the larger community tables so if it's busy, get comfortable and maybe make a friend :)  My coconut pancakes were really good but at one point the compote got to be too sweet so I just ate the pancakes and the coconut flakes and some sort of cream on top. Could've used more of the creamy goodness but they weren't as generous on that as they were with the compote. My matcha had a weird, almost fishy taste to it. Kinda weird but I drank it anyway.   We'll be back. There are more items I wanna try!

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matcha Latte
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Pancakes

xwU_517t2XGDjitjAAi3-w.text: Very cool, chic vibe. I loved the green as you walk in and the natural wood tables. You stand in line to order and they give you your 'name' rather than a 'number' as you sit and wait. It's half serve yourself and half they serve you. For not having your own personal waiter, they were all still very attentive and friendly. The atmosphere is very cool and fresh but can get a little echoey and loud when it's full due to the minimalist look of the walls and their high ceiling. Sometimes, it's the price you pay. I think it's worth it. The food was great! My son and I both got what resembles a Persian omelet, with tomatoes and egg. It had a little heat which I'd have them add more next time but perfect for my 8 year old. The lavender latte was incredible! I'm so glad I tried it! It may be something I just stop in for! The one minor issue I had is that my son finished his toast with his sashuka fairly quickly. The line was too long to stand in again for just toast but All in all, the place and food were lovely. We will return!

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qt9rlQU0PPSie8PUXtiXZg.text: The decorations and interior inside was nice and well put together. I also loved the plates and cups they use to serve your food and drinks in. It was perfectly thought out. We got the steak and eggs and the salmon toast. We also ordered the orange juice and the mocha lavender signature drink. Everything was perfect. The food, the drinks, the atmosphere. The salmon came out first and it was pair with a fresh  salad. Loved the dressing in the salad. It was refreshing. The salmon was delicious was well. It was fresh and not fishy taste. I liked the cucumber and cherry tomato on top of it. It was a well balanced dish. Our steak and  egg came out as well and it was delicious as well. The potatoes was soft and cooked well. Our egg was made perfectly. We finished everything we ordered. It was a perfect breakfast meal.  I will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummyy
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome dish !

sZGkLp4OsxMXx9qnHB5Y2A.text: We were visiting Vegas and wanted to get breakfast somewhere off the strip that wasn't touristy.   This place has a really trendy and hip vibe. Entirely different from everything else we had seen in Vegas, which is what we were hoping to find!   The location is interesting. If we didn't find it on yelp, we never would've never noticed this place and could have easily just driven right by. It looked like a closed building at first glance.   I was surprised to find that it's not one of those places that has a cool atmosphere but not so great coffee and food. We LOVED our breakfast and the coffee. Generous portions, everything tasted like it was made from scratch and they knew what they were doing.   Love that they have take away coffee cups and to go boxes right at the counter. Makes it so easy!  Food came out really quick and the staff was really friendly. Clean bathrooms (which I have to note, because it's important!), nice spacious open and well lit restaurant.   I could definitely see us coming back here next time we visit, because it's great to get away from the strip and relax and recharge there.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute little to go coffee cups

YHWEIV07w0iAI3frG362_w.text: Wonderful small place especially for breakfast. French toast and most other stuff I've tried on menus was wonderful. Open for lunch but closed for dinner.  You really will like this place so give them a try. Tough to find but across street in shopping mall from Ikea.

t3yRiYpWppG9ebg3HYadcg.text: The service was stellar and the food/drinks were the best! My family and I were visiting and this place popped up and it far exceeded our expectation! The four of us all have different taste but we all agreed every dish and beverage was delicious!   For beverages, we recommend the hot white  mocha, iced mocha, and the iced peppermint mocha. Food wise,  we ordered the Mushroom Swiss Burger, Pastrami Reuben, Steak & Eggs, a lemon muffin, the Breakfast burrito in a bowl. It was all so tasty and all the components on the dishes pulled it all together! We ate it all so quick, I was only able to grab a few pictures. The staff and cooks were super friendly and made the whole experience there that much better! We will definitely be back next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs, Iced Mocha, Peppermint Mocha, and an Iced Peppermint Mocha.

Fiw3e6BB05_Uiig_24IQxw.text: Our favorite breakfast brunch spot. French Toast, Corned Beef Smash and Queen Bee Lattes are what we order most. Quick efficient and friendly service.

d0FTCuOclPbsCd2rPdVtSA.text: Delish breakfast spot and not crowded if you're an early bird (before 9). Staff could not have been friendlier, menu was great and the food was impressive. It's a healthier break from the usual egg spots.

0xSxtD5N_pQPynMFYAzqQQ.text: I come here a few time a week. This restaurant is practically my neighbor, it's a  2 minute drive away.  My regular orders are: Shakshouka  Breakfast burrito Porto-rito Lemon coconut pankaces Lavender and Chai lattes.  All of them are great. I love how everything tastes fresh and is far away from being your typical American junk food breakfast.  It's rare to find a place that has good food + good coffee. This is the closest thing I've found in Vegas. I just wish they had larger coffee sizes sometimes!   Their pastry items are also really good. Definitely give this place a try!

S_ghp3d9eWFpyg2xSk0apA.text: Ordered an acai bowl..... yikes that was a mistake. It was extremely soupy and had almost no toppings I basically paid $10 for juice in a bowl with a few bananas. Our table's orders kept getting mixed up and coming out at weird times. Not to mention there were lipstick stains on not one but TWO of our water glasses. Just an overall messy experience. I guess if you want a good Instagram post with no regard for your actual meal this is the perfect place.  Edit: it was THREE glasses with lipstick

pM-1Du8zoZ34GFEi11rmXA.text: I have been wanting to try this place out for quite some time & i'm very glad we did! Came here for brunch & don't let the outside fool you..upon entering, interior is very spacious! Plenty of tables loved the black and white classic theme all throughout and the green plants/succulents adds a very nice touch.   Service was fairly quick. I ordered the mushroom burger with fries and a lavender iced latte. My boyfriend ordered the breakfast burrito with chipotle aioli on the side, which I used to dip my fries in.. both selections were absolutely delicious & we were very impressed with the large size portions. I also enjoyed my lavender latte, I needed it. We were not disappointed.. I think i found my new favorite brunch spot!

pq6spTV10D6ogjGF8J6CKA.text: Super cute place. We went on a Saturday at 9:30am and it was definitely busy but the service was still great. I order there eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast and it was delicious! The potatoes were so good. I even got the strawberry pineapple lemonade and it was so tasty. Not overly sweet at all. Can't wait to come!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uMrRMD_1fecuG1yFRzb2qw.text: Not a huge menu, but what they do offer, is all delicious. The hot coffees are always perfect sweetness and perfectly drinkable temperature right when they bring it out.  Definitely try the breakfast burrrito and coconut pancakes. Yum.  Nice open, casual environment. My new favorite breakfast place

MFk-uSXSMHaJMSHQIoFiNw.text: Absolutely delicious and REAL food!!! The BLATC sandwich was juicy and scrumptious.  The rib-eye steak and eggs was so tender that I could cut it with a knife.  The restaurant is tucked away but it's a diamond in the rough!  The food is organic and the best I've tasted in Vegas!

KWfUln9qBNGpZ-NLQcovAw.text: Some of staffs are very very very  rude!!!!!!!!!!! I've ever seen Kid-Unfriendly Restaurant in local Vegas. They ruined my moring!!

aA5KIPYe0Is97NpX4t1mEQ.text: This place is amazing!! Exactly what was missing in this area! The Shakshuka was perfect and i mean perfect!!! Fresh tomatoes (not can) the expect amount of spiciness and the eggs are in the perfect temperature- very rare to find a place in the USA  that serve this so authentic and right. Delicious     4 Stars only because they don't accept Amex- which is important

fcx_gtWZ0cft6J3TePvbWQ.text: Took a friend to try Neighbors because he wanted to go to a restaurant that hearty and healthy. I suggest Neighbors because the atmosphere is so comforting; I love the wood tables and the plant decor that is everywhere! (My room decor is actually inspired by Neighbors haha) Anyways, my friend got the summer squash pasta and I got the coconut pancakes. I had coconut flakes in every bite and enjoyed every moment of it! I also ordered an ice chai latte with my pancake. Not sure if it was because my coconut pancakes were just really sweet but the chai latte tasted watered down.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer squash pasta &amp; coconut pancake

pApMrw47hIvox2QIQu6RyQ.text: The place is good but the service is the worst. We ordered 2 breakfasts and the one was brought to our table. Waited a little not to be rude until the other came. Well I started and finished half and spoke to someone and said it was coming. FINISHED MY MEAL and no second breakfast. Well at this time the other person lost there appetite and I wanted to leave. Well no one gave a shit and acted like the happens all the time. No APOLOGY. Most places bring your meal at the same time. WHY??????   Tell everyone--

91pLMD96m5MqG8hgaLIOSw.text: Tried this place for the first time. We think we found our go to place for breakfast! Good food! Nice ambiance and close to home! Highly recommend this place!!

XzFG1klkED7z6IJPo7wt5w.text: The atmosphere is very inviting. The decor is very clean-cut.  You order at the counter, they give you a name plate, and deliver your food to your table.   It is much different than a typical breakfast spot; the food isn't heavy at all and they offer vegetarian options.   As the name suggests, definitely something new for the neighborhood! Check it out!  (Four stars - the sausage for the Old School was undercooked. When it was returned the rest of the plate was cold)  Pictured: COCONUT PANCAKES and LAVENDER LATTE w/ SOY (delicious combo!)

uEh8IvddLamDK8aHksa91w.text: This a great little local breakfast spot. Hidden in the back of a strip mall, its definitely worth finding. Great decor and better food. The coconut pancakes are amazing.

pTzk_pGcRnO0Pu18WYeNVQ.text: Very clean with lush plants when you walk in. This place smells delicious. I ordered iced earl grey tea and a breakfast burrito   Delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pastries look fresh and delicious

NrRfBCLDe4FCTJCIYp9clQ.text: Got the salmon toast was pretty good I love onion but the onions or radish or garlic something like that over powered the toast. Also had the portobello wrap bc it was the only vegan option they had for my sister and a cold brew! The restaurant itself is really cute with wood tables and plants at the entrance as well as a wall of plants and succulents which are my fav! The reason for the 4 stars is the lack of variety in the food for all people weather you eat meat or not as well as healthier options and a tiny bit over priced. In the end it is worth checking out and customer service is good.

icWnGX3LhW25H2jSz0cyxQ.text: They're rather new to the neighbor so I gave them a try.   Nice decor and ample seating. Ordered the waffles only found on the "kids" menu-why? Adults like waffles too. They were very good but came to the table barely warm with cold butter and barely warm syrup and way too much powdered sugar.  The Chai Latte was weak and  only warm not hot. The pour your own refill was great, food came fast and staff was friendly. Minuses: Some order takers provided incorrect info when asked about menu items.   Despite the minuses I may give them another try sometime.

cV-mC57KKcn5us7s868UjQ.text: Randomly found this place on Yelp and thought I'd give it a try and boy am I glad I did! Had the blu-j smoothie and avo toast. Both amazing. Plus had a lemon muffin. To DIE! Would recommend and will be coming back!

w8s0QSiHYRjqbVPdP6lxtw.text: I love their AVO Toast and Lavender Latte in the morning. It just gets my day started right. It's a little noisy during the rush hour, but the food more than makes up for it. Besides if your in good company, it really doesn't matter. It's different in that you order your food like you would at a fast food joint, but they serve you like a restaurant. Kinda reminds me of the way Carl's Jr. use to be back in the day, where you would be given a number to be placed at your table and then they would bring the food to you. It's a nice concept, verses waiting for a server who may take some time to you because other things are detaining them.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CPTmZcIh44USA6aiXNKUWw.text: Literally the cutest place ever!!!! The last time I was there I had the Avo Toast and Queen bee coffee....delish! The atmosphere was pleasant along with the staff I was having brunch with a friend during this visit but I could definitely see myself taking my kids the next time too. If you're looking for a super cute spot to eat with some friends or even date, I highly recommend Neighbors Cafe!!

leGoOogarbRTN7QhzWLLJw.text: I decided to finally stop by Neighbors. We ordered Pacific Smoked Salmon, Shakshuka, side of Potatoes and Pancakes. Also, ordered the Super Green smoothie. Out of everything that we ordered the Shakshuka was flavorful. Everything was only okay. I was looking forward to the Super Green but it wasn't anything special that made me want more.

9_Gx-6a_Ieue2dEjcRCNOw.text: This place is located in an odd business area. Though some things are a little pricey, my overall experience was okay. I got the AVO toast and it tasted just like any AVO toast I could get anywhere. I got their seasonal strawberry pineapple lemonade and was disappointed to taste only strawberry in it. I love the ambiance of the place and would like to return to try something else off their menu!

b2-2PYNQh4YJLJjyN80w4g.text: Love the breakfast burrito!!! So juicy. Delicious. Full of flavor. Mmh. The best breakfast burrito I've had here (haven't had alot though).. I also had the steak and eggs. Also juicy and flavorful, perfectly cooked and delicious. Service was great, everyone is really friendly and welcoming!

THptZQYJf5GzI3bUebTE8w.text: new favorite brunch place hands down!!  the vibe of the place is so cute. when you walk in you're welcomed by cute wooden benches and green hanging plants everywhere. our first time was today and we were greeted and told what to do (look over the menu, order at the counter, pick our table, and just wait).   i love how they have gluten free, vegan, and vegetarian options for my friend! it makes everything easy and it was simple.    we ordered the avocado toast without egg for my vegan friend and the steak and eggs & sweet potato fries for my boyfriend and i to share. it was more than enough food for us. the chimichurri sauce was so good and the steak was cooked perfectly and wasn't chewy at all. the potatoes it came with were crispy and yummy. the sweet potato fries were the BEST FRIES EVER!!

fqhEMeBJE2GTNu-ZLMbBzA.text: Oh my goodness.  This place is amazing.  Really hip vibe upon walking in.  You pick your seats and order at the front, they bring the food and everything to you.  Ordered a white mocha latte with almond milk. Really light on the white mocha taste, but delicious.   I ordered the steak and eggs. And wow. I am thoroughly impressed.  Not what I was expecting. But the food came out as pretty as every photo I saw online.  And the taste. Wow. The taste.  I liked that they pre sliced my steak. And the sauce they used. And the potatoes. Wow.  My mom and her friend shared the breakfast sandwich. That thing is huge! And they said it tasted very good.  My dad got the muesli and he enjoyed it too.  We are all super happy about our meals and coffee.  The ambience is great and the staff is real friendly too! I hope my new friend at the front desk gets his hair to his hair color goals!  I'm most definitely coming back and bringing the rest of the family.

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kiN8oR9_MnEUNBvCQIGDSQ.text: Not a big fan the food arrived 1 by one they brought my side toast 10min  before my bfst  , you also have to serve yourself grab your own water your own coffee  if you looking for nice experience go somewhere  else.

I2nFQtnFpx72E6XLgzWYaQ.text: I was in town visiting my sister and we decided to try a new spot she had heard about. Food + Vegas is my favorite equation these days so I was all about a new brunch spot. Recently opened Neighbors definitely fits right in with all the other solid brunch options in the southwest area. I did make a joke about the business sign facing oncoming traffic looking more like an ad for real estate, rather than a hipster brunch spot , but not holding it against anyone, lol.   Ambiance and service were great. Spacious dining area with plant life, wooden details on the hardware are a nice aesthetic. Attentive and prompt servers. Self-serve water.   I'd give the food a 4.9, only because I felt my Acai bowl was a little too watery, texture-wise. But it was a good bowl.  Breakfast burrito was awesome, pancakes were top notch.  I tried the Queen Bee Latte and an Iced Matcha Latte. Both were really good.   Next time I'm in town, I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Açaí Bowl
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito.
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced Matcha Latte

h7i8vzR3-EKYVrH7BexZ8A.text: Amazing customer service! They are nicer than I expected! And I just experienced my favorite corn beef hash ever! Usually corn beef hash is minced down very tiny but at Neighbors they make it with nice big chunks and the meat is so tender here! I give them 5 stars and five drool emojis!  thanks to the chef Tom!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get this one! Life changing CORN BEEF SMASH

XOeuH2EUwus8E-kvZGbuDg.text: Tried this new brunch spot in town and it did not disappoint! The place was decorated nicely with lots of lush greens, very bright and clean.  We tried the Mushroom Burger and the Breakfast Burrito, both are really good! We also had the Queen bee latte, it reminds me of Better buzz's BDE with a hint of cinnamon. Looking forward on trying the avocado toast next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Burger with sweet potato fries
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito

uhPHmwRmW80yFOo4Z_e6Ig.text: Amazing restaurant and it's right next to my home. You have to be careful not to miss it because it's inside a little area next to a pre-school. I had the Steak and Eggs breakfast and my lady had the Portorrito breakfast. It's a little pricey but well worth it, I will be returning for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portorrito

ORW3rqA0CjOpY0Z0RC0kUg.text: Went here because it came up for local food to where we were and decided to give it a shot. Hubs got the breakfast sandwich said it was good but a bit over seasoned for his liking, potatoes that came with it were ok but a little dry. I ordered the avocado toast because I can't seem to ever pass that up and it was good although the avocado was a bit over masked for my liking and need a bit of salt/pepper (personal taste) the poached egg on it was cooked to perfection. I'm not a big poached egg person but this one was nice, light and cheesy so whoever made that knows what they're doing. Ordered a side of bacon to go with and that was like cold, hard fence posts... bacon isn't hard to do just please don't overlook it like that. I was like eating cardboard so not finished. Overall atmosphere was ok but with so many hard surfaces it was was a bit on the loud side. We sat in a corner and could hard hear one another sitting across from each other and this was during the week so I can't imagine how it would be on the weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Toast
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Toast

Zv0t96HFSAAZ9yW3yH5Jug.text: Neighbors has a great decor. That struck me walking in--lots of natural light and solid wood. A nice balance in terms of the occupancy capacity too.  The match latte is quite nice, slightly sweet but not cloying, balancing well with the slight earthiness of matcha.  The steak and eggs was solid though I wouldn't say it was spectacular (hence four stars and not five). The steak itself was ok, just not particularly memorable. The accompanying eggs and smashes potatoes were nicely done though.  Overall, it is a nice breakfast and lunch spot that I would definitely go back to again.

Awbe0JcR7XRpgsjq7O0IYg.text: I love this little not so well kept secret cafe here in the Southwest. They have savory dishes and attentive staff. The pastries are amazing too! Today I popped in for a hot lavender latte. A delightful morning treat.

mOzIsHKeXvghHZM6uXvsZQ.text: This is a very nice new spot for breasfast and lunch! This is a beautiful place. It gives off a calm and relaxing vibe. Staffs are friendly and the food is good!  I've been here twice. I had the french toast and the beet salad. I love the granola and the strawberry, they add the prefect crunch, sweetness and tartness to the french toast. The beet salad has good flavor, the argula is prefectly dressed, beet is cooked nicely (not to soft and not too firm) and the feta on top adds a great saltness to tue whole dish!    Overall I have great experiences here. Lovely atmosphere, delicious food and friendly staffs. I'll definitely be back!

3zgV8NbIpr1azFHujtBNFA.text: Craving avocado toast and found this great place. Very relaxed atmosphere with modern, simple decor. The food was amazing and the cinnamon honey latte was so good. We will definitely come back to try lunch!

MP_BMoQTmGtv-oiqJLHcsA.text: I enjoyed the brunch here. Food is very good. The environment is beautiful. I like it. I recommend this place for brunch.

Menu selections are varied for breakfast and lunch and marked for vegetarian, gluten free, etc.    Once you order you can pick any table and your food is delivered to you.  We ordered the breakfast burrito and the two egg plate. The food came out quickly and was delicious.

RpsHrzcCamZGddscmF04oA.text: Great food & great service. One of the best breakfast spots on the southwest. Highly recommended!

MEyMGbJCLR63LZfBUhLWkQ.text: Undercooked runny eggs, burnt potatoes, lettuce on my plate??! (Why?)!, hard, bland fruit. Soft bacon. Only 2 GF option. I am sick to my stomach. I will NOT be back. If I could give a zero I would.

juVkA6ZCDZtC3MJnECBH5g.text: We love this place. The avocado toast, queen bee, Nutella and white raspberry cafe drinks are our favorite oh and you can't go wrong with the coconut pancakes!!!!

wphtdKVlYKeN37vA7bCP-w.text: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  When they first opened, everyone was so friendly and attentive, but now the employees don't really greet you and the servers don't even check on you after they've dropped off your food. The steak that comes with the eggs was tough.  LIKE  All the plants and decorations. WiFi. The smoothies.  LOVE  The regular and summer menus. The breakfast sandwich and burrito. Open later than most breakfast places.

NZCwD46bT2tH-ela6sI7cg.text: We had been planning to visit Neighbors when they opened and just happened to come by on the soft opening. The restaurant is beautiful. The modern design with all the neutral colors, wood accents, and live plants make for a real relaxing environment to start your day off with.  We started our brunch with the Steak and Eggs and Chics and Waffles. The Steak and Eggs were good. The  temperature on both the eggs and steak were spot on. The chimichurri sauce was mild in flavor, but I didn't mind it because I got to taste more of the flavor of the meat. I got to taste a bit of the chicken which was also good.  There are lots of other things on the menu that piqued my interest. The next time I visit Neighbors I will try some of their healthier options because they look awesome in all of these Yelp photos.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs

MEO80CX9xn88X899OBCU1A.text: My goto is the Nino burger, love the egg. Great atmosphere and decor. Our new neighborhood default brunch place.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SJXML-K9rIR5lYE5hkzMZA.text: The first two time I went to Neighbors I loved it. I hyped it up quite a bit when I told my husband about it. We decided to go together on a Monday morning for breakfast so he could try it.  This visit was disappointing. He ordered the old school breakfast. He also got an order of French toast. I got the acai bowl. He was disappointed at the prices. The french toast didn't come with anything, that's why he ordered the breakfast too. His eggs came out first. Then my bowl about five minutes later. He never got the french toast. When he mentioned it to the server, the server went & got a copy of the receipt & showed him he wasn't charged for french toast. I heard him order it so... We also found it irritating that we kept having to walk to the counter over & over for silverware, napkins, water, coffee, ketchup, etc. Every time we'd sit down we'd realize we needed something else. The toast that came with his breakfast was served dry. He had to ask for butter. There was no offer of jelly or anything like that. The food server was running around like crazy with no help.  Sort of disappointed this time around. My lunch was better & more reasonably priced. I don't recommend it for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old School breakfast
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry quinoa salad

Q518LhDyJE9xNkAyEjXniA.text: This is a super cute spot. The food is average to me. But their coffee and latte's are unique and delicious. I'm giving them 3.5 stars.   It's. A nice place to pick up and go, but you might have to wait a little to get your drinks on a busy weekend morning . I like that the kitchen is open and you can see the cooks at work. Quality assurance, yo!

ZwUmV5COTmWY4EO0ScDV_g.text: I recently met a foodie friend here for lunch and was very impressed with my lunch.   The inside of the cafe is large and simply decorated. Plenty of other customers were there with it being noon on a weekday, but we still had our pick of clean tables.   As soon as we arrived an employee greeted us and gave us the regular menu as well as the summer menu. Since it was my first visit I appreciated getting the menu ahead of making it to the counter. All of the employees that I encountered that day were friendly. My lunch and drink were prepared quickly and delivered to my table.   The Lavender Lemonade was a unique menu item and refreshing. The lavender was just a hint and added to the flavor of the delicious lemonade. The Chipotle Chicken Sandwich was very good. All of the flavors with the grilled chicken were perfect together. There were several choices of bread and I went with a grain bread that was delicious. The sandwich was not only delicious, but a lighter choice that didn't make me feel guilty.   Overall, a great experience! Great food, interesting menu options, and great service are the perfect combination.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Lemonade

vKG3dA_dkkUDDPIlDMYAfw.text: This is a really cute brunch place to meet with your friends. It is a local and hidden which gives it a community feel. They have a lot of parking despite being tucked away. When you first walk in, it is a bit confusing because the food menu isn't posted, only the coffees. We had to find a spare menu on the tables and bring it to the register to order. After we ordered, we found a table quickly despite it being a packed house. Luckily they have a very large spare dining room to accommodate their long line. This restaurant lost a star due to customer service and timeliness of food delivery. The food runner dropped half of the order and then brought the second half 15 minutes later. We asked her for waters on her first drop and asked for ketchup on her second.  She laughed in my friends face and said "seriously is that it?" It was so shocking that we stared at her in disbelief that she literally laughed-our-loud at us. I will give this place another try because the food was good, it was clean and easily accessible.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best chai ever! + Wild Berry Parfait

-l-5Gzn1fhYlc2PPHCNqRA.text: This place really had to grow on me. When I first came here I wasn't a fan. I just wasn't impressed with the food or service and didn't think I'd come back.  Fast forward another 5 visits you can say I'm a fan. I really like the chipotle chicken sandwich here. The fries are pretty good too. My boyfriend usually changes it up. He liked the mushroom burger the most though.   The service is kind of slow. Sometimes it's hard to get the persons attention that is serving the food.   When you walk in you put your order in at the counter and they give you a sign with your name, which is a nice touch. It really confuses the servers because some people have the same name (obv). They might want to consider putting the last initial as well to help the process.   The cafe itself is super cute and clean. If you're nearby def give this place a try. I probably wouldn't drive across town for it though.

nI3wrmo9Rf9AEBev2MBK3g.text: I am going to be one of those people who put one star due to negligence of keeping the ONLY item I order here out of stock every time I come. Every Tuesday or Friday after my private French class I drive the opposite way home to stop by here (17 mins out of the way) for the open faced salmon sandwich with a smoothie. For the past month I have stopped by here salmon has been out of stock, at least! Today, I am just fed up! So this is myself throwing an adult tantrum because I am unable to eat somewhere where I enjoy eating. Get yourself a new stock boy, Neighbors cafe. You just lost yourself a customer who spends min $20 a week at least.

bwj-Er88MmAOR5iZcYV29g.text: I can't bring myself to rate Neighbors higher than 4 stars.  Neighbors is fast-casual dining with premium-casual prices. They do have Vegan, Vegetarian and GF options, which is a wonderful touch and makes the dining experience easier on those with such preferences.  You are expected to seat yourself, grab your own waters & coffee but still pay $12 for French toast. Your order takes place at a bar and is prepared and delivered from the open kitchen, which I love.   There were 6 of us. Our two kids (age 7) shared the French toast with a side of fruit from the kids menu with no problems.  The food overall was good. The concept though, is kind of strange. *shrugs shoulders*  Also, the entry is full of plants. Which I personally find attractive and impressive since everything I touch dies. Lol

2IwS14McAR2hwYznYTPMHQ.text: I went basic today and got the overnight oats with the London fog drink! Extremely happy with both!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W_PliCtSOy5Ds1bfXnfreA.text: Love this place(: the aesthetic itself is perfect, especially if you're like me and appreciate the little details that go a long way. The staff were great and the food was yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast

EKVau0mvVE-8yl6tMpl-8g.text: Found this place from the Yelp app. Yay! Score another one for Yelp! Located in an out of the way office building, we passed three other breakfast places getting here. Those three had good reviews on Yelp, but this one sounded intriguing. MUCH bigger than you'd think, you order at the counter, then have a seat while they bring the food out to you. There were quite a few items on the menu, so we sat down first to peruse the menu. Water and drip-coffee are serve yourself at the counter. Nice glass glasses for the water, and ceramic mugs for the coffee (with lots of fixings, not just cream and sugar).  I didn't see soda, nor a soda machine, but the menu board above the ordering counter listed it, so maybe?  The food was FANTASTIC! Definitely not fast food, we had to wait about ten minutes, but WORTH IT!  I had a breakfast sandwich on multi-grain bread. My wife had a frittata. Both were tasty and came with greens, so we felt healthy! Actually, the greens that came with the sandwich were out-of-this-world good! I asked and they said they make their own honey dijon dressing. It's just a bit of sweetness in a light vinaigrette dressing. AMAZING! They should bottle it for sale!  Customer service was really nice, as people came by often to check on us. A quiet atmosphere and delightful decorations within, we can't WAIT to go back!

b3ogVB8HatOtjU-UuJCIVQ.text: I would rate my experience a 7.5/10. The avocado toast was okay, the coffee was delicious and the French toast... one of the best I've had.  The space itself has more of a restaurant feel to it. It is very loud as there are no walls to separate the kitchen from the dining area.  The employees were... nice? although stern and to the point. No conversation was made with the guests. The food runner did not smile nor did he introduce the food to the table.  It is a nice spot but I do believe that it could use some improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Toast and Lavender Latte

BP8L5lIgOi5w1XPlDEIBeA.text: Went for a late breakfast on Friday and it rocked!  First off, I'm not a big fan of ordering at the counter, I prefer the standard waiter/waitress taking our order, but this wasn't too bad.  The main complaint is the wait in line to order.  After that, the servers were very prompt and accommodating.  I had the steak & eggs, it was excellent.  The steak was cooked perfectly med rare, the eggs over easy and the chimichurri sauce was outstanding.  I'd drink a cup of their sauce.  My wife and grandson had the breakfast burrito and the Old School breakfast, both were excellent.  Overall:  an outstanding place for breakfast or lunch.

2DZ4RRG6LidIUapYfcYs4w.text: Cute place. The food isn't so great. I could have made it at home and garnished it like crazy. The prices are too high for the food and the service wasn't impressive. You have to wait in line, pay and then sit down. There were a lot of customers but like I said, the food was subpar. We weren't even full from the food and we don't eat much. I hope they consider that and re think their portions and quality of their cooking and taste of their cuisine.

AU7tbC5W9lEUrvBBmEJPag.text: Came here for brunch after reading all the reviews. Sadly, I wasn't impressed. It is very loud and hard to hear your conversation. The portions are small with ok flavor nothing special.  Reminds me of skinny fats just less on the eyes and less flavor in the food. I'm not a big eater but left feeling unsatisfied. I guess it didn't help that someone came in smelling of body order and quickly stop eating after that whiff.

DbVqgD241mRhbxJe63FSZQ.text: Atmosphere This place is very very cute with all the rustic styled knick-knacks and plants scattered around the restaurant.   F&B I thought was food was okay; it can use some improvement. I am pretty sure the vegetables in my winter protein bowl were cross-contaminated.. My friend who is a picky eater wasn't a fan of her dish, but she has been several times before me despite warning us of a certain item that she had in the past that she wasn't a fan of. She overall enjoys it here and I can see why. I wanted to like Neighbors more than I did. The drinks here were perfect. I ordered a seasonal raspberry mocha that was sweet and delicious. My friend's chai was also top notch.  Service This was also just okay for me. It's as if they wanted to create a cafeteria disguised as an adorable restaurant and avoided hiring hosts and actual servers. Good workplace for introverts!  Overall To be honest, outside of the cute decor and tasty drinks, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone. I am willing to give this place another shot a few months down the road because I think this place has the potential to be an excellent diner.

My friend and I shared the steak and eggs and lox toast. Everything was fresh and yummy. I loved the dressing on the mixed salad. The lavender latte was superb. Will definitely come back again to try their other items.

dw5x6iIIZTXSTBlwfspJ7A.text: Loved the cute inside of the place! Quiet enough for studying but also a great place for a breakfast/lunch date. The overnight oats I had were AMAZING and the drip coffee was good as well. I definitely would recommend visiting this place.

8Kg-iwqPooa1RWiG5nXIXw.text: Neighbors is a super casual brunch spot  suitable for families and friends. The order first, find a seat later concept was pretty un-involved for my liking to be honest. After receiving our food it was nearly impossible to locate an employee to request additional assistance (of course i didn't want to walk to the register) .   The French Toast presentation was definitely five star worthy, however the taste was underwhelming. The syrup was minimal and the overall taste was just okay at best.  Shakshuka was a pleasant surprise to the menu. Saucy, a little spicy, seasoned with cumin served in a skillet full of messy deliciousness for the win! If your adventurous I'd highly recommend this Israeli/Middle Eastern inspired (I'll let you decide which) anytime of day tomato, chili peppers and poached egg dish!      Nearly $40 for two...

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shakshuka $10 (Vegetarian Friendly)

F5uMz_rgcCjL5YLE58iJug.text: This place was really good. Reminded me of a few places in Orange County and in San Francisco. The restaurant had a clean hipster and minimalist vibe which I appreciate. Beautiful aesthetics.   I came here to brunch with a friend of mine on a Sunday morning which also happened to be Father's Day. I had the coconut pancakes ( I don't even like pancakes) but these were really appealing to me due to the coconut, blueberry and lemon components. The were wonderful , please have them non pancake lovers. My friend ordered the granola French toast and those were really good. Very comforting and basic however not boring. I recommend those also.   They stole my heart due to having a lavender latte. I love all food things with lavender and it was really good. My friend ordered the Matcha latte and it was delicious, I'll be having that next time. Overall, I great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a girl and her lavender latte.
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut, blueberry pancakes. It had a beautiful hint of lemon that helped cut the sweetness and richness of the it all.
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matcha green tea latte. Very nice silky taste.

690yWith-g1ie_-Ql3I94w.text: Suprisly good .  Great vibe at this location . Food was good 8 had the shakshuka and it was amazing . My girl had some avocado toast was nice and no more then that .   Price was fair and food was good .  A lot of sun in the restaurant so was very bright

0xhoiZ-NTdi7fizDqGAo9A.text: I popped in while in the neighborhood () for business. They were suggested by a barista at Vesta Roasters because Neighbors uses their beans! I got an americano and a breakfast burrito. The burrito was delicious - great mix of flavor and content. The americano is good. I believe the coffee bar is full service but comes up short of a pour over. This place is cute and bright and I will definitely be back!

qrzyMP6o721KAaGrZd8xnw.text: My first time dining at Neighbors Cafe was wonderful. The food is terrific & the service is spectacular. The cafe is large, airy & pleasant. I brought a book and enjoyed a leisurely breakfast, with a latte, and both were delicious

xm_qGch3GJr1A79KsrqX8Q.text: Really enjoyed this place! Loved the atmosphere and all the plants. Location is a little unusual, if it wasn't for a friend recommending I would've had no idea this place existed. You order up at the counter, seat yourself and then they bring you your orders, friendly staff. One of my favorite items was the strawberry pecan loaf/bread! SO yummy! We got the coconut pancakes, breakfast burrito (huge) and quesadilla, all satisfied with our dishes, no complaints. Variety of options on the menu, breakfast and lunch along with coffee's and teas. We'll be back!

sTTommI9AgRyLjkrWWckXg.text: I've driven pass this location several times and never noticed it. Thank you for the word of referral!! I seen a friend post a very delicious looking French toast with fruit and went straight over to Neighbors. Very splendid mom and pop breakfast/lunch joint. I enjoyed a burger with fries. My new favorite spot. Thank you for a beautiful atmosphere, pleasant smiles, and good food!! Very much appreciated.

dKZJGSdv2L2X7MddLt7dcQ.text: Good fresh breakfast! They were efficient and it was sooo delicious. Wish I had taken some pictures but I was starving and it was gone in 2 seconds. The food was hot even after I drove home. You order like Panera so I took mine home to go. However, the atmosphere was nice and the decorations were super cute. I will be eating here again!!!!

H28lRNxY111ArCGUwtDLFQ.text: Wow this place was great! I got the breakfast burrito which was really good! The potatoes they put in there are so good, the eggs were fluffy, the sausage tasted so fresh and the tortilla was good quality. I also got the coconut pancakes but I wasn't a fan of them. They had some kind of berry syrup on it that I didn't like. My husband got the steak and eggs. The eggs were fluffy, it had the same potatoes as in my burrito and the steak was very juicy and soft. I will definitely recommend people here! The customer service was great! Everyone was extremely nice and they kept checking on us to make sure everything was good or if we needed anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v5RkkS6leu5LF7of19WIdw.text: First time trying lunch! Like it a lot. Courteous staff, everyone I've encountered. Chef acknowledged his customers and showed care. Excellence. Clean, dining room and facility. AVO was prepared to the right taste, and portion size. Mat Latte Yum!

dy-sIP6fNLnHB84u99ihfQ.text: Great breakfast spot for something healthy. I ordered the Shakshuka but I don't recommend it. I was expecting something different. The lavender latte was great also the avocado toast and the steak and and eggs, fresh juices too. The seating arrangement is order and find a table, not my favorite. Parking was easy and the service at register was great!

KTCJeD3UvmMFwna0u9SJsQ.text: First of all, this place is EXTREMELY aesthetically pleasing and is decorated with cute plants throughout. It's a bit pricey, but very worth it. The waiters here don't come up to your table, you order at the counter and they bring the food to you. I ordered the berry quinoa salad ($10) with smoked salmon on the side ($5) and a mint lemonade ($4). My brother ordered a pina burger with sweet potato fries ($13) and also a side of smoked salmon. All together we spent about $40. The smoked salmon definitely wasn't worth $5. The food was pretty tasty though. The sweet potato fries were just the right amount of crispy and the burger was really unique. The salad was alright though because it was missing some flavor by itself. This cafe is pretty cute though, I see myself coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry quinoa salad and a piña burger with a side of smoked salmon and a mint lemonade

qCboG2x2BasfDZcYABEJcw.text: What a great Neighbor.  It is obvious that the team cares at this new restaurant.  Fresh, delicious food in a positive space.  Shaksuka skillet was a healthy, tasty choice. Avo toast with poached egg was another Bingo!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bcDh45stwvQPN3Y6gWfHWQ.text: So yummy! I got the coconut pancakes, avocado toast no egg and my boyfriend got the steak and eggs. Even the most simple things were delicious and they did cool designs on our coffee. The coconut pancakes have lemon, berries and coconut and were out of this world. My boyfriend was amazed at how good the smashed potatoes were and his steak. Customer service was really good too. I'm only giving 4 stars because they boast being vegan but only offer two small vegan options. They should at least include a meal that is vegan if they want to include vegan on their menu. Overall pretty great though!

r4isyBBvCI664boLllPpvA.text: Yelp recommended this hot & new breakfast joint and it did not disappoint! This is the first trip my girlfriend and I did and we're definitely coming back again. Atmosphere is awesome, food is delicious, and service was great. A must try for breakfast foodies who are always looking for new places to try

tkeRLOxCNYrnsO1W9cyk3g.text: Super cute, trendy and clean brunch spot. Friendly staff and nice menu that can accommodate a good range of appetites and food restrictions. Indoor seating only, coffee selection is nice and free WiFi!

spaQcsKWKQ-PY9gxe9vkcQ.text: Good presentation! Everything looks amazing but it tastes just average. It's beautiful inside with all the greenery but it's really annoying to order cafe style and have to wait so long. It's also really hard to find. Definitely won't be coming back.

U6RdfbjmLXLE2iJXM3eaag.text: This place is awesome! Everything we ordered was delicious and beautifully made. Quality ingredients, friendly staff, great ambiance! I'll be dreaming of their breakfast burrito for weeks to come!

1F6j6WjBg6k0ExsQnSkUzQ.text: Decided to check this place out for the first time earlier today. By far the best decision we made for lunch. I had ordered the shakshuka with sour dough bread. To be honest this kind of dish is fairly new to me I have never tried it before but I don't regret it either. It was very delicious.  My bf ordered the coconut pancakes, OMG let me tell you I've never been a big fan on pancakes but this was amazing. The zest of lemon, the sweetness of the coconut, and the tartness of the berry syrup. It's like a vacation in your mouth. I'm just blown away on how it tasted so good. I highly recommend it! They had a variety of teas and lattes to choose from. I also saw they had some fresh juices to choose from as well. I ordered the Queen B latte which was the perfect taste of honey and cinnamon. The vibe and setting there was comfortable, peaceful and happy. We will definitely come back again.

5VvXmTEncYpNdfmvuJBH_Q.text: Really nice breakfast /lunch spot. Coffee is smooth, baked goods are amazing. Had breakfast burrito ...I can see why its a best seller. Steak & eggs with chimmichurri is so flavorful. Parking can be tight on weekends and its really noisy but has great vibe. Wishing for patio seating!
