wRvtOFZ8Y2LtEt2eq99ObQ.text: Freakin deliciousness! Exactly what what I love in a brunch spot... fresh everything, amazing barista offerings.  Smashed redskins crispy on the outside, so yummy, worth ever carb!  Avo toast was delicious! Beautiful simple presentation... real coffee cups and plates,  no plastic or styrofoam! Really nice atmosphere in here too!  I'm so coming back!  Well done folks!!

W7aSHQ22eU4cJPwkRZZ_Uw.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch and I was kinda let down.  The ambience of the place is quite nice. Open floor plan and relaxing colors abound.   The menu looked to have a number of interesting dishes but I went with the Pina burger and a iced been tea. For those two things it nearly set me back $20 yikes! I would not have guessed that judging by the location and the actual portion size of the food.   The burger was not bad, the pineapple and charred burger patty was tasty, I just wish it was bigger for the cost. The sweet potatoes fries didn't have any seasoning that was detectable.   The biggest let down though was that all of the waiters was standing at the counter with there backs to the dinning area 95% of my meal.   I needed napkins bc the egg told had got in my beard lol... after waiting for a few minutes I noticed these gilts never gave the customers and I just walked up to them to ask for them.  Next when my ice tea went empty not one person ever came by my table the entire meal. If your going to charge $3.5 for a simple glass of ice tea. Please refill it.    Interestingly this place solicites tips before you get your food. I hate this as most of the time the service is really lacking because they think, hey I already got mine!!! Funny thing on the screen the options was 10% 20% 30%.  Well I did want to try the pancakes but I doubt that will happen. If your in a burger mood Bachi nails the menu better. And if you want a coffee well maybe this place is for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lol waitresses never came by. They just had there backs to the resturant lmao. And you work on tips???
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pina burger and sweet potatoe fries.. meh
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Neat name plate system

Dxa8smesbeTtkitHglTvYw.text: Not really a fan. I was confused on the service when I entered for breakfast. The reviews made me feel like this would be a cool and friendly place to visit. The people who worked there seemed confused too...No hellos or is this your first time here questions...The food was delicious but the fact that people around me kept getting up to gather silverware, napkins, condiments etc was aggravating. I to had to get up not once but twice to get utensils. I'm not really sure about the two guys that stood up front and their positions. The only thing I could see was that they brought my plate to me and handed off the bags to the Uber and Doordash drivers. Maybe this is a futuristic place that caters mainly to pickups orders because it seems as though the guest inside were pretty much invisible.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Old School Breakfast

YYnimd8SJMOQ4LlldqN1nQ.text: Finally went and tried out the place. Very easy to find as it was directly across from my friend's house.   The space is gorgeous! Open floor plan, cute wooden tables and the decor is very clean. Love the greenery in the room. The big windows for sunlight makes for great pictures.  Food was decent. I ordered the pancakes which were very light, fluffy and flavorful. Definitely didn't need syrup with the house made sauce they put on it.   My friend's steak and eggs were greatly presented. Never been a fan of precut steak as I love to cut it myself, but their presentation of stacking it like a jenga stack was a breath of fresh air from the nornal sliced at an angle and fanned out on the plate like most places do with precut steak. Chimichurri was good. Their rainbow smashed fingerling potatoes reminded me too much of CRAFTkitchen's smashed breakfast potatoes. However, theirs could not hold a candle to the aforementioned restaurant. The potatoes lacked the crunchiness and creaminess. And the marinade made it look messy, not clean on the plate.  My friend who ordered their breakfast burrito, I am just a person of aesthetics... for the price he paid, I'm sure the cooks could've rolled that burrito tighter and actually put more filling... you can definitely tell there was no care put in to that burrito of how flattened it looked. I've rolled enough burritos and sandwich wraps to know how much filling and care goes in to making one.  All of the food was overshadowed by service. I'm sorry, if you're going to provide a refill service your tea, at least be attentive to your floor. Just as it was pictured in another review, servers still had their backs towards their guests. I understand it's not a full service restaurant, but if I'm going to pay for a $3.75 glass of tea that isn't that big to begin with, people do expect a refill. I'm fine with refilling my water. I do it whenever I am at Crepe Expectations.. but even if you moved to refillable teas as the server made a point to inform me, "Oh I'm sorry, we just changed from non free refills to free refills," then please don't keep your back to your guests and just stand there with your elbow on the counter chatting away with your coworker.   On another off the subject, I now understand their 15% option on their payment for tips. Here's a tip for those complaining about the service after paying: don't pay the tip on the card of you're hell bent on complaining why the tip option is available (based on another reviewer complaining about it). You can easily put no tip and just leave money on the table.   I'll still come and check out the rest of the food, because it was great. Just like Pho Saigon 8 in Henderson: you know you're going to get bad service but you suck it up for the good food (however, their service has improved as of late - the server who ignores you doesn't work there anymore haha). I am in the area frequently so yes I will still support because of the good food, but I hope service standards get improved upon.

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apparently there was free refills available but had to let the server know to refill me _

Wn-9gNzJC0eNa6ksmiGkvg.text: Omg! This cute little gem!! My friend texted me about breakfast and we have a "usual spot" but I said, "hey! I've been wanting to try this new spot" and so here we are! Wow!!! What a cute place and great breakfast! We not had Shaksuka (Spelling?) stewed tomatoes, feta, basil, peppers and poached eggs in the cast iron skillet DELISH! Red potatoes on the side and avocado crema on the side too! This food was so YUMMY! The cashier and server was so kind, friendly and cheery! I love morning peeps! Thank you Neighbors for a wonderful experience! Highly recommended!

flOz-JWkXnF6GZjRrS2R6w.text: Succulents and plants galore! You first enter an open, clean space, confront a long line, and scurry to an empty table. If you can nab a table, you'll be good. The line is intimidating but actually not that bad. The food comes out efficiently and quickly, too. The place is green and welcoming. We ordered the French Toast with their granola, strawberries, and honey butter. That granola is addicting. We also tried the corned beef hash with crispy potatoes in a hot skillet. Such unique flavors! The queen bee latte was also balanced with the honey and cinnamon notes. A fun place with a good energy.

8e_xHRet0qnrkz4N1Kn7bg.text: I came for brunch on a Saturday. It was busy, but not crowded. The place was large and sunny with plants to bring some greenery indoors. The food was absolutely delicious! I ordered the breakfast sandwich and swapped out the chipotle mayo for the garlic aioli. The sandwich was flavorful and the ingredients perfectly complemented each other. The side of potatoes were extra crispy and tasted more like chips. They were probably the best potatoes I've ever had. I also tried the queen bee's latte. It sounded unique, but it was actually kind of basic.   Overall, a lovely place for brunch with outstanding food.

gTIYMcgm3tQ8VTBd2zT5Bw.text: My friend and I were together earlier in the day and were wondering what to eat for lunch. Since we don't have the chance that often, and it was a Sunday, I offered up the idea of brunch since she loves breakfast foods. Considering our work schedules and tend to want to wake up so early on off days, breakfast foods is not often an option.   When we had looked up brunch, this was one of the new places we didn't recognize and it was close by, so here we went for a new brunch experience.  Located just south of Russell and Ft Apache, Neighbors is located in the east half of a standalone building (totally thought they took the entire building until we walked in). Process is pretty simple. Go up to the counter to order and take a seat at a table of your choosing. To my own surprise, it wasn't as busy as I had expected.   Menu is small but fairly wide in variety. My friend had gotten the 'Old School' with orange juice while i had 'Steak & Eggs' with a cappuccino. After paying, we were given a tag where they write your name vs a generic number tag to place on your table. Don't poke at the writing as it comes off easily. A regretful idea my friend dealt with.. hehe !   One thing we didn't know is you grab your own waters, utensils, napkins, and accompaniments (sauces) next to the order area. Didn't find that out until we got our food and asked the waiter who delivered.   The 'Steak & Eggs' is a 8 oz ribeye topped with chimichurri sauce, smashed potatoes, farm eggs, and toast.   Mildly splurged a little due to the rare occassion. Of course the steak had to be medium rare with over-easy eggs. Toast? Sourdough ! Steak was pre-sliced and stacked w/ layed chimichurri sauce. Not a perfect cook but still tender and juicy. Chimichurri sauce is one of my favorite sauces to go with a steak, if any sauce is used overall. The smashed potatoes was surprisingly yummy. Small boiled potatoes w/ skin cooked again on a skillet (this is all a guess) and pressed to break the skin and create some crispy fried aspects to the edges. This is something i've been wanting to try and it was pretty yummy ! Eggs were perfectly cooked. Sourdough bread was amazing ! one of the better sourdough breads i've had. Crispy but not too hard exterior with a soft chewy interior. Great top mop up some of that chimichurri sauce w/ the rich runny egg yolk  The 'Old School" consists of 2 farm eggs any style, choice of double smoked bacon or sausage, smashed potatoes, and toast  Over medium eggs w/ choice of half smoked bacon and half sausage, and sourdough bread !  She said the bacon was a bit overcooked and hard to eat. The sausage was really yummy. Reminds me of a style of breakfast sausage. Very juicy and flavorful.  We both thoroughly enjoyed this bread and is highly recommended to anyone who tries this place out. The plating of the food is amazing (IG worthy hehe) and the portion size for the price is good. As another reviewer had said, cali style, vegas prices ! Heck ya !   Oh ! forgot to mention our drinks. OJ was nice and yummy. Drank it after having my cappuccino so made it taste sweeter than it should be. Nice amount of pulp too ! Cappuccino was pretty decent with a nice heart design in the foam. Fairly strong but tasty. Size wise of the cappuccino was mildly on the smaller side though. OJ was pretty good in size.   I wanted to order coconut pancakes too but being two people and our small stomachs for the first meal of the day, yeah that definitely wouldn't work. Next time maybe?   Friend had mentioned people complaining about the overall noise of the restaurant. I feel like its fairly normal. Open kitchen. Open dining room. What you expect? A library?

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old school
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange juice and cappuccino

0s6JN5bhnsSunp7l8G6qgw.text: Sunday brunch, almost all the tables were taken, and there was a line of about 8 people ahead of us. Talk about fast service! I am impressed. The line gave me time to figure out what I wanted to order, but it moved pretty quickly. The menu is kept simple, which I like. You order your food, find your own table, then the servers will find your name tag and deliver the food to ya. Again, it was a short wait before we were grubbin. I got the Shakshuka with sourdough bread and an iced lavender latte. I rate the Shakshuka a 5 out of 5 and the lavender latte 3 out of 5. Prices are reasonable and it had a fresh atmosphere inside with succulents everywhere. I think everyone was taking pictures with em....even myself lol! It's kind of tucked away hidden so make sure you don't drive past it like I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shakshuka
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shakira shakira.....just kidding....... Shakshuka x2. Lavender and Queen Bee iced lattes.

KODZoG41AjhS1VDne1nQ-Q.text: I was really excited when I found out that this place finally opened (I drove past it a lot when it was under construction). When I visited, it was on a super busy Sunday afternoon. As some reviews have mentioned, you walk up to the counter to order first then find your own table, much like how Panera does it. I wish they would change this because it does get quite chaotic when it's busy like how it was when I visited. There were a bunch of people standing around eyeing for the next open table, and it was confusing as to where the order line started.   Onto the food!  Matcha latte: Omg. I'm in love with this latte. I want to marry it...that's how good it is to me. I'm super picky when it comes to matcha and this place definitely got it just right. It had a nice hint of sweetness and a strong green tea flavor. You just have to try it especially if you love matcha!  Shashuka: this is a dish of 2 eggs poached in a sauce of tomatoes, red peppers, and onions. Feta cheese is also sprinkled throughout. Comes with slices of your choice of bread for dipping (I got sourdough). I pretty much ate the whole thing because it was just that good! The flavors of all the ingredients were wonderful and the red peppers gave it a nice little kick.   I will definitely be back for another visit. I have my eye on the lavender latte and the Queen bee latte!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shashuka with sourdough bread
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matcha latte with heart

g_IdOz2extBMYrYCVqjSJQ.text: I found this restaurant through an instagram influencer that I follow. Without her post I would never have tried this place. My first visit was great. I liked the atmosphere and the food was great. Since then, I have eaten there several times. I took my husband once (he says it's girl food so he won't go again), I took my grown kids there and I've even eaten there by myself a few times when I had no one to go with. I've even ordered delivery. I joined their rewards program, etc. Today I went with some family to show off this cute place down the street by where I live. I am aware that they are a breakfast and lunch place so I checked the time and I was good. We would have 30 minutes to grab a quick bite. I said hello, grabbed menus and found a table to read their menu. I then went to the counter and placed my order. The girl asked if the 2 sandwiches I was ordering would be the same I said yes and then she asked if I was having g a salad fries or sweet potato fries and so I said one with sweet potato fries and one with a salad and then the girl rudely said, so they are different not the same order, (ok )then I had my sister tell her what she and her son wanted. I then pulled a $100 bill to pay and she weirdly and rudely huddled with 2 other workers (pretty sure one was a manager)and whispered...she took a while and I'm just waiting there.....patiently. She then gives me my total and says this will all be to go, is that ok? I said no, you close at 3pm. She said oh but we close in 25 minutes so it all has to be a to go order. I looked around and they had  at least 5 other tables with customers. I told the girl, you know, maybe you need to change your store hours if you're going to do that because I got here at 2:30, that's plenty of time if you close at 3.  She said...oh no, we do close at 3 but it will all be to go right now. What?! I mean c'mon ....it doesn't say we close at 3pm and between 2:30-3pm we are solely a to go restaurant. Needless to say I am very disappointed. I have noticed their service has been in decline but that was not right. All the people that were already seated may have easily stayed there until 3pm for all I know. I have worked in the service industry for years and I would never consider being so unprofessional to my customers. My mother even noticed a cook looking pretty pissed that we were ordering.  I've been there. I've hoped customers wouldn't show up on my last hour so I could go home on time but I never put on an attitude or made my customers uncomfortable. I actually was super helpful so that my customers would not feel rushed or feel bad for coming in. There are store hours for a reason and its your job to service your customers. (I did nothing wrong and did not deserve that)That's how you guys make money and pay your wages. I no longer work and I love going out to eat but I guess I'm done with this place. I'll take my money to a better establishment that values having good customers like me.

PeF9GArRo8NtkP5Q1z09ng.text: Neighbors opened just a couple weeks ago. It's a hip modern-style cafe; upon walking in you're entering a large walkway area to the order station. If you take a look around while walking up to the cashier you'll notice it's somewhat of a minimalistic style, simple but eye-catching and decorated with greenery.   I came here mainly for coffee, and found out their coffee menu is also very minimalistic -- definitely not a bad thing because as they say, less is more right? They have a Queen Bee latte sweetened with honey and topped with cinnamon that tastes amazingggg. My friend jovi got an iced mocha latte which, as simple as can be, was made to perfection. It tasted amazing as well! Now moving on to the food menu, found on the back of their paper menu rather than the board. More extensive than the coffee menu and offering a few vegan choices as well (for those of your interested). I have yet to try a vegan option on their menu, maybe on my next visit.   I've visited Neighbors twice (with jovi) during their grand opening and ordered the mushroom burger on the first visit and the salmon toast on the second visit. The presentation of the food definitely fit the modern, millennial style of the cafe (even most of the employees fit into that type of "style" if that makes sense). One bite of the mushroom burger and OH MY GOODNESS  it was made with a beef patty and topped with onions and a bun with some kind of aioli sauce if I remember correctly. Jovi ordered the avocado toast, and I declined her offer to try a bite since my mouth was too busy with my burger, but she could not get over how good it was either! The second visit with my salmon toast and a side of greens also left me  it was basically their version of a lox bagel but on a slice of sourdough instead. Still bomb. am definitely going to visit again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast, mushroom burger, Queen Bee latte, iced lavender latte.

MWXeyuDP0f0Hec3IvEihaA.text: Brand new eatery in the area. Had the opportunity it try it this morning and wasn't disappointed! The space itself is inviting and very relaxing. The employees are super friendly and can answer any question you may have about the wide variety of food and coffees offered. They were all super excited about the opening of the restaurant and being able to serve the community a healthier food option! No matter what you order you'll get a deal.   I had the breakfast sandwich which was absolutely amazing. The presentation just added to the experience. It was by far the best sandwich of any kind I have had in months. I'm not big on spice, but this sandwich had a little kick to it which put it over the top. Not too strong, just enough to throw your taste buds for a loop. I chose a side salad with it (yea I know it was breakfast but I'm trying to be good!) the salad was super fresh and had a unique spin on it. The dressing was fantastic!! Wish I had the recipe but I guess that means I'll have to come back in for more!!  Overall the experience was fantastic and I will be going back! My advice to the employees and managers is to keep it up and keep it about the food experience. Don't get caught up in the penny pinching as your food is too good to cut corners with ingredients and effort. Quality over quantity will win every time. I have no doubt this place will take off and be the go to healthy option for the community!

UXwjRN5REpweQS6Nv1dTdg.text: The food is amazing and I love the overall look/ambiance! The pastries look unbelievable!

LRwEfs8Z1LdJGYeaeYG1gw.text: You can easily tell that Neighbors goes the extra mile. Fresh ingredients are paramount. All breakfast dishes are flavorful and avoid the heavy oils commonly used in many breakfast restaurant kitchens. Their kind and competent staff, quality ingredients, variety of healthy options, and lax atmosphere make weekend brunches a hit every time.  Pancakes were REAL good. A little small in size but fluffy and full of all the right flavors. The Arugula side salad had very fresh greens dressed in a citrus vinaigrette that struck a balance between light and sweet. Everything I want out of a side salad. Their house potatoes easily passed my checklist for a great breakfast potato: crispy and well seasoned. The eggs were cooked to my liking and the pork tasted great.     "Everything just tastes fresh and good" - my gf

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unwrapped breakfast burrito with a latte!
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Old School with fruit subbed for toast. Delicious ingredients and solid portions. Definitely recommend.

ckAHSFNQQ_rzL3PI2WH2oQ.text: This place is okay. The woman at the register was nice. I hate that I'm pushed to tip when I pay at the register, but I have to get my own water and utensils? Stupid. My food didn't come out together, the soup and quesadilla came out separate which was weird because I hadn't ordered the soup as a beginning course, but part of the main meal. The food tasted good, I had the tomato soup with a steak quesadilla and fruit cup. Fruit cup was nice, had a lot of berries which is a good sign. The soup was good, solid tomato soup with basil. The quesadilla tasted good, but was way too much for a single serving. Like, I'm not a freaking lumberjack, this is one meal. Tone it down, save on costs and waste, maybe charge a little less. Also the plating was boring. It looked so plain and kinda sad. Just stacked on itself, no sides or prettying up with a sauce on the plate or anything. *sigh* I may be spoiled by LA brunches, but if I'm gonna pay that much, I expect better. The atmosphere is okay. No music that I could hear. Upscale brunch crowd on a Monday morning, all the children I saw were well behaved, which was nice. Would I come here again? Probably not. It felt uninspired and expensive. $25 for one person to eat (plus undeserved tip - no one even checked to make sure the food was good, just brought it out and cleaned up). For a place called Neighbors, they certainly skimp on interaction.

-TQb8Dg_Q84jfGa8-Cz8eg.text: Came in on my lunch break and decided to try the queen bee latte and overnight oats. Our food came out pretty quickly and the service was really great! I wasn't a big fan of the latte, it was a bit to strong which is great for the typical coffee drinker, However I prefer mine a little more on the sweet side. The overnight oats was delicious and very esthetically pleasing.

JrsNfqlCeml5m9BhlkOh3A.text: My food was excellent. It came out fresh and delicious and I barely had to wait. I will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Old School

0YSVBrpMufl0b0EnaoavGA.text: We decided to try out this new spot for breakfast while taking a break from running errands. First impression: this place is fancy! Liked the ambiance - green plants, sunlight and wooden tables. When we walked in, we were greeted by the friendly employees. One of them handed us their regular and summer menus. I panicked a little because their food seemed way too complicated for me. Since I'm petty and not a big fan of breakfast food, I prefer to keep things simple. Saw that they had something called the Corned Beef Smash on the summer menu, which got me excited, but of course it had stuff that I didn't like - bell peppers and onions. Figured these would be pre-mixed just like all the other restaurants who serve this dish. But to my surprise, they told me that they can make it without them. CoolCoolCoolCoolCool!   This is an order-at-the-counter-and-sit-down kind of place. While we were waiting, one of the employees brought utensils to our table. When the food arrived, I was impressed. Very nice presentation! This wasn't your usual looking canned version of corned beef hash (see picture). It was smaller potatoes and corned beef cut in perfect portions, topped with chimichurri and served in a skillet! On a side note, there was also supposed to be an egg on top. I asked for it on the side and gave it to my husband since I don't eat "visible" eggs other than in fried rice, LOL. Overall, it was good, but the chimichurri overpowered the dish. At the end, it felt like I was just drinking vinegar or something. Ugh. Maybe they should consider cutting it down a bit? My husband ordered the Old school and said it tasted alright. If you are looking for simple, this one is probably it because it comes with toast, eggs, bacon/sausage and potatoes.  Cool cafe with friendly service, but unfortunately I'm not about the fancy breakfast/brunch food. Glad to see they are doing well though!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Smash - on the summer menu

Q6PW1xhVVz3zqPa8z6v4KA.text: I liked the vegan breakfast options and the fact that they are open early.  The place has a cute, stylish design, and you can see the hot air balloons flying off in the distance (if they are flying)  Two of us grabbed breakfast before hiking at Red Rock.  We ordered 2 portorritos.  They were good but the burrito is all that comes on the plate.  For $12, it would be really nice to throw in a side of beans, salad, fruit, or something. (- one star)     Add on 2 almond milk lattes and you have a $36 breakfast.  A bit pricey for  a Vegas breakfast, in my opinion.

RIAqB_ojomADu_u-ab8UBg.text: Great breakfast/lunch spot. I had beet salad with chicken that was fantastic and my boyfriend had breakfast burrito that was great. Deserts look delicious too, and huge!

56sTdOl3UcWnhz09EY9pyg.text: Very fresh good tasting food. Wife had sausage and scrambled eggs with a lavender latte and said it was all great. Wish they could do some noise cancelling decor but then again I'm old!

NtE16cu_JZZPKIkZv-4iuA.text: I have eaten here twice.  Once for breakfast and then again for lunch.  I had the scramble for breakfast, and the grilled chicken and avocado sandwich for lunch.  Both meals came out quickly and hot.   Service was good and the restaurant is clean.  Everyone very professional.   Highly recommend eating here.  Prices are a little higher then other places but quality and size of meal makes it a fair price.

a6dQSOidey0kcCpjwSJ8-w.text: The breakfast sandwich is amazing!!  The eggs are fluffy, the bacon is perfectly cooked, and the arugula gives it the perfect crunch. It has a sauce that gives it just a little kick with just the right flavor. It was great! I also ordered the queen b coffee. You have to try it!

OspCIN5SOww_WAbvcAHyNA.text: Delicious! The feel of the place once you walk in is very welcoming. The staff is beyond friendly and helpful. I had the breakfast burrito and a lavender latte. The Avacado crema made this burrito the best breakfast burrito I've ever had and the chipotle sauce they serve on the side is delicious. The chef came out and asked how our food was which just added to my experience. I will definitely be back.

K1CqXzXWPCKK02-hjvR7BA.text: So happy we came across this little gem. Very friendly staff, trendy interior and modern technology for the cashier station. Food was is excellent and delivered quickly. They cook the food and then deliver it as soon as it's made, no sitting in a window. We didn't try and coffee but it looked great and they had plenty of options. I highly recommend this local place!

vWvm07M1JyYLWrXZ2DWJAA.text: I went to Neighbors Cafe during lunchtime on Friday. It was quite busy, but my food and coffee came out without much of wait time. Since I was by myself, I needed a quick bite. I ordered breakfast burrito. The food was really good. I ate half and took out the rest for later. I liked the decor with all fresh plants. I would definitely go back with my niece. She will love the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latte

DjH0OOTyLa-8xYo7JIQNiQ.text: Food presentation really nice.  All the food has fresh ingredients and was delivered hot off the grill right to the table. It was our second time there I had the French toast and it was perfectly cooked

9CLNoz-01-RhdkyBjpTmMw.text: I'm honestly not impressed. Great decor, coffee & food was ehhhh, it wasn't bad but it was just underwhelming. Service was good. Love that they have vegan options but I just had high expectations from here. Awesome place for the gram.

6yisDWQHMB5WJE_5lW4m9A.text: Very cute. Food was great. I got my food to go and everything was packed nice and still tasted great when I got home. I told a lot of my friends about the place already. I'm sure they will be around for a while.

Ro1zyk-tprEEgo3dnP0fqA.text: Cutest little breakfast and lunch cafe near Southern Hills Hospital. The inside is quite large for a cafe. The ambience is very laid back, makes for a perfect coffee date. The decor is basically plants everywhere, which makes it vibrant and welcoming. Ordered the queen bee latte and a breakfast sandwhich. By far the best breakfast sandwhich I've had! And the latte was yummy too. The regular latte is very plain and does not taste that great. But I also tried the vegan "fun guy" burger which was delicious, for it being vegan there was a lot of flavor to it. The service is quick, did not have to wait long for our food to be served. Will definitely return for breakfast and lunch here. The prices are decent. And the food is great! Very nice hidden gem!

a-GRWtA7Ko3oDRK0jSxbOQ.text: Love this place! Food is great atmosphere is awesome! I've had a few different dishes and have not been disappointed. Try it. You'll like it I promise!

m3HpBmkOjYgB2iROaBAL9g.text: We are so happy we found this cute breakfast/lunch place so close to our new house. Great food! Good prices! You can just tell everything is fresh and made to order. Yum!!

Y9OrH66-wm3R_l7ocZSaRg.text: New to the neighborhood an amazing restaurant with a very interesting fusion! Today I tried There cheesesteak sandwich and it's outstanding! Britney was very kind and knows the menu well! She suggested their home made herb aioli and it's delicious ! Can't wait to try a new dish

XY1zBjC7gIoir6WIvH3tLA.text: Stopped by on a whim during their soft opening and absolutely loved it. Had the rise and shine acai bowl and the breakfast burrito and they were both amazing :) great quality for the price! Love the environment, very modern, tons of plants with a rustic industrial feel. Bohemian vibe. Will definitely be a regular spot for us.

3TImGOhF9HG9Bf72W9MLbg.text: Such a great new addition to the neighborhood! Bright and cheery place with very pleasant staff and super tasty food. Great place all around. Flavorful chicken BLT sandwich with iced matcha latte on the side.

SERVICE:  They only have one waiter :( but very friendly.   PRICE:  See attached receipt. I'll let you decide... lol  FOOD: Very tasty with a kick! Chicken is too crunchy for me... lol

nnIX41PJ9sgYvMvH1U-0LA.text: Place has a great vibe, but overpriced for an Avo toast. 9$ for a lil slice of bread and side salad. I kinda felt theyre taking advantage of us basic bitches.

OkjhhKTr6qwjWievwP7_Ig.text: Went here during soft opening- for breakfast. Everyone of us got a different item and there wasn't one thing that we didn't love. Great idea, great food. We will definitely be back.

qrFZqAg2ko2xGLuetB9W1w.text: Great food. Always looking for a good breakfast place. Atmosphere is relaxed and food is good.

AP-AG0d-cLKxxX_8XAnjuA.text: Really like the place, so cute and good food and coffee! Definitely recommend this place

H6rP0tKYI34k4CZ_H2mwNA.text: Great food and coffee. Very clean and relaxed vibe. Family friendly. I babysat for an 18mos old and would bring him with me. He loved being in there. He did get a little upset once but the cook noticed and cheered him up. :) Was so sweet.

VnqKXy8lcteCdXpoLqi2fA.text: This is such a cute cafe, very close to my gym at my house. The staff was super friendly. I went there with a friend of mine and we both got different kind of toast. Hers was with avocado on top and mine was salmon on top. We also got two different kind of coffee drinks which were fine. The place is super cute, it's not very loud and the food was great. I will definitely be back

5_kkLWtk3gOu34y6HVDceg.text: Love the aesthetics of this place but everything else is just meh. First off, there is literally two gluten free vegan options on the menu, so I was forced to choose between the two. An acai bowl without the granola as it wasn't gluten free. You're really losing out on business with such a limited menu for people that eat vegan or gluten free. Even if you're just vegan you have about two options. For such a new place I was surprised of the lack of choices. Either way the acai bowl was just ok, already a bit melted when it got to me. The service wasn't great either. The cashier was super friendly but the guy that brought us the food barely said two words and didn't offer silverware or napkins. When we went to grab some, there were no napkins or silverware left. I just think that when it's busy they may get a little bit distracted. It's also super loud in here if there are a lot of people due to the hard floors, I literally could barely hear my mom over the screaming kids. My parents enjoyed their food so definitely has great options for those that aren't vegan. I probably will only be back for tea or coffee on a not so busy day as it's a cute spot in general.

7_Um479bv6g232ElU-R-8g.text: I usually order to go but I dined in this time and it was excellent!! The employees are very nice and the food is great! One of the employees was a little awkward but still nice. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a breakfast/lunch place with fresh and tasty food!

4B6GJ0Vb10pBUQY_6iEn9g.text: My parents wanted brunch so we came here bc it was close to us and it had good reviews. The inside decor is really cute with a lot of natural sunlight. When we got inside, this tall blonde girl gave us four menus and told us to sit wherever. After about ten minutes, we realized we're supposed to go up to the cashier to order and pay. I wish the girl had told us instead of us waiting and awkwardly staring at her. She didn't come to our table to ask us if this was our first time, what's popular, nothing. After we ordered, we waited for our food and it was pretty quick. The food was really good and the presentation of it was really pretty. We got steak&eggs, BLAT, and coconut pancakes. Pretty good I must say. Right when we got our food, the blonde girl asked if we needed anything and that was it. She never came to us again until the end to get our dirty plates. Towards the end of the meal, my mom asked her if we can get refills on our drinks while she was taking the plates away. She said yeah and walked away. Yeah and then she never came back. So my mom was trying to get her attention and even yelled excuse me once (embarrassing lol) and she didn't look at us at all. Even when she went to the area where she grabs the food to give to customers, her back was to us the entire time. Kind of felt like she was doing it on purpose. So I felt like she ruined the whole experience for us. In the future, I feel like this is a to go type place bc the food was so good tho! So four stars for food but two stars knocked down bc of the blonde girl. Been a minute since I wrote a review but she truly annoyed me. Unless this is a real hipster place and it's always like this, then it just didn't suit me and my family.

pYx0UXhTOFsv8syXtE0MfA.text: The food is delicious, but the semi-service is confusing. We had to figure out that this is a place where we have to get our own utensils, water, refills, napkins, and whatever we may need with our meal, after the food order is placed at the front counter. The confusing part is that there is usually one or two food servers that seem to only drop off the food and drink at the table without any utensils , then never come back, but are still tipped. Besides the semi-service, this place closes at 3 p.m. It would be nice if this place extended their business hours, at least on the weekend.

mVcH1PvQ-jogRClSHPIexg.text: Great food! Their grilled chicken quesadilla is so delicious and so fresh. Cute and simple decor and very bright from natural sunlight. Service is fast and friendly. They also have complimentary water and coffee. My husband I have been there twice with our 1 year old and we have seen a lot of other families there. The only downside is there was no baby changing table in the women's or men's restroom. I was a little shocked by that considering it's such a modern place. Definitely worth a visit though! You won't be disappointed in their menu.

mLRm2g9J26ATyKZ3bjLSvA.text: Don't be fooled by the outside appearance. Neighbors is a breath of fresh air. Well decorated, clean, and open. Only took a few awkward moments to realize there is no hostess and you order at the counter. After ordering there were no instructions on the open seating or the self serve area (right next to the register you pick up utensils, napkins, complimentary water, condiments, etc) I think this should explained, this is not a typical cafe procedure. No biggie, just should to be explained. I ordered the Avo (avocado toast), side of fruit, and tea. Food arrived quickly and is high quality. Unfortunately I was eating solo or I would have more to write about. The Avo is well balanced, poached egg was perfect, and the dressing on the greens was divine. Side of fruit had all the goodies (not just boring melon) -blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries. I'm definitely coming back to try the rest of the menu.

Xw5szJ5NH8keJjd1EiHsgg.text: Love, Love, Love! This place is awesome! I love their Queen Bee Latte-I can't stay away after trying that. Love the interior, there is lots of seating and I love how they've decorated it. It's also a great place to work, not too noisy, and they play great music!

hsAmv59RQ6NcSsOI1hYUdg.text: what a great place.  this is a welcome respite from the ridiculousness of vegas.  we came here the next meal after spending $50 on two cheesteaks and fries at nathans foodcourt at luxor.  stopped on our way to red rocks canyon for awesome breakfast and cold brews for like $25.  probobly our best meal this whole trip highly recommend!

VpwoXw-GbdxJSdA4W1ZA8g.text: This place is amazing. It is our new go to. Everything we've had has been super good. Drinks are bomb, service is awesome.

LrIvmDrRwGx5sUuZhb8UjQ.text: If people are commenting first on the decor, then they need to reevaluate their priorities.  Staff is super friendly and selection is good though not so much if you are a vegan.  More options to choose from would be nice - a veggie burger, tuna salad or something else.  Prices don't seem to be consistent when you are doing take away - one price one day - another price two days later and a third price last day.   All in all, neighbors while not the best - Mr. Mama's and Weiss - still are better but they are new kids on the block and will get better as they go.

bzmNPng15G3i1drJxt_Rrg.text: I was craving a breakfast sandwich for lunch today and saw the good reviews on Yelp, this place did not disappoint at all. The breakfast sandwich on sourdough was top five for me, and living in Vegas that's a treat. Good ambiance, nice facility, friendly staff, and they offered a side salad instead of potatoes which, to me, was paired perfectly. Will definitely be back.

l3Bs1u2vfxiEwkG_-vIU2Q.text: The place has a nice ambience when my wife and I first walked in. It was around 11 am Saturday. There was no one to greet us at the door. We were a bit confused. We saw a line to the cashier but were not sure if the line were for to-go or dine-in. My wife and I decided to get in the line (15 plus people). After 30 min of waiting in line, we came to find out that after we order, we have to wait approximately 25 min to have a table. At this time, there were about 8 people standing around who ordered already but without a table. We angrily left the restaurant without ordering anything. I am not in the restaurant business but this place is poorly run. I believe there should be someone at the door to figure out if the customers were dining in or ordering to-go. If it's dining in, tell them how long the wait and assign them tables before they walk up to the cashier to order or direct them directly to the cashier if ordering to-go. I think if they can make some improvements on this aspect of the restaurant, I might give them another try.

3pXaHqMPFISZ1tMASGt6Fw.text: Eh.  Trying to be to Bougie.  The set up is cool, tables, chairs and plants very clean.  Service eh, everyone stood around at the counter talking to each other.   Food Eh.   Don't see his place lasting too long.  Probably better as a coffee shop.

_s9iWwBcBaCGFXOQfW3-pA.text: This is a nice breakfast place. You order at the counter and can refill your own water and coffee, so you don't have to worry about tips. You can also seat yourself and tables are usually immediately available for Sunday at 10am, so no waiting. I tried the shuksha?, was disappointed because I've never heard of it before and it looked good in the pic. This dish has no beans, although it says "chili" in the description. it's basically two small eggs in a tomatoey sauce, and was too spicey for my taste. Portions were small, we were still hungry after our meal. Also, there aren't any omelettes that I saw on menu.

St_IdrNXOkJBfQz033yyHA.text: Atmosphere , service, ordering style was 5 stars. Unfortunately the food does not meet expectations. Ordered steak and eggs, the steak was very pale full of fat and just bland. I'm use to flavor and this just didn't do it for me. I had to send eggs bacck twice couldnt do scrambled or over medium right smh. One side of bacon which consists of two pieces for 3 dollars was very small and thin. I don't know how the hell it was double smoked. And on top of that I ordered lemonade which they told me was sweet but actually it's just taste like watered down lemon water . From the reviews it seemed like it would be delicious but it didn't make expectations at all. Especially for the price it wasn't worth it. I was better off going to Whole Foods and cooking my own breakfast

uwgLcBzUknGjZaJVcfb-Mg.text: Yummy yummy food at a great price. Could eat here for days. Options for everyone: meat lovers, vegetarians, vegans, gluten free, etc.. friendly staff and bright ambiance make it a nice relaxing place to eat. Will definitely be back soon

Wn6cb2bktJOI7Pz7NWiZiw.text: THEY'RE NOT CLOSED! And thank God for that! This place is phenomenal. Though in an incredibly odd location, it's worth finding.   Old School Breakfast: Basic but delicious. A solid 8/10. Ask for the sausage extra well done, if you fancy. Yum!   Lavender Latte: 10/10. I make my own lavender latte's at-home and Neighbors blow mine out of the water. Absolute must-try.   PB & Oats Smoothie: 10/10. SOOOO good. The peanut buttery taste is spot on and the oats do not overpower. Delicious.   Berry/Mango/Quinoa Salad (with added chicken): Solid salad. 7/10. The only thing I'd recommend for the restaurant: pair this with a strawberry poppyseed dressing instead. The vinaigrette doesn't really match with this salad well.    GO!! You won't regret it :)  PS. They do catering through "GrubHub for Work" for your office lunches.

ausxhLsj2P3DdQNNjZo5qA.text: Leave it to my coworker for finding little places like this. This place is nice, has friendly staff and great coffee. The Americano is good and better priced than that other guy! I only wish they would have noted all the ingredients for the overnight oats.

sm104GthybnuhcVk0520IQ.text: This place is a joke! Ordered a burger well done because I don't like to eat ground meat pink. A good steak is a different story. The middle of my burger was 100% raw, not even medium/well. No sir, the chunks were still very mooing. Sent it back... 20min later I get another burger that is so burnt to a crisp the meat was black charred. Jeez.... way to lose a customer.

gO4O-sbs_1LLFLbRHIY_RQ.text: Long line? No worry because your food will be out in a flash!  I met a great group of here for a girls brunch.  I believe we were all eager to check out this great spot.  Pretty pastries were lined up in their case just calling my name.  The blueberry muffin won me over as it was fresh and full of fruit.  This pastry certainly got my appetite brewing for more.    I shared the breakfast burrito as well as the Coconut Pancakes.  Both of these dishes were large and in charge.  I was blasted with fantastic flavors from the pancakes.  The toasted coconut chips with the blueberry lemon sauce made for a delectable breakfast.  The fresh blueberries were abundant making it an awesome stack of pancakes!  Of course the breakfast burrito was filled with so many great items~ eggs, sausage, smashed potatoes, cheese, pico, and avocado crema.  It is certainly a huge burrito that can get you through the day.    I can't write this review without praising the service.  The line can get very long especially on the weekend.  The staff kills it with kindness.  From taking the order to the lightning speed of receiving your food, it was all done with a smile.  Thank you Neighbors for a great start to the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Muffin
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Pancakes

3b7rCtna1ZmoxPkI-qjiaA.text: Best breakfast of our Vegas vacation!!!  While vacationing in Vegas, we spent a day off the strip. Yelpers led us to this little gem for breakfast and it was perfect! On a weekday around 9:30am, there was no wait and plenty of open tables. The entire menu is served from open to close so you can get whatever you want: sweet, savory, light, hearty, or just one of their divine selections of coffees, lattes, lemonades, etc. The ambiance is calm and comfortable, and the food is beyond amazing in flavor, overall quality, and presentation. The establishment is set in a plaza with plenty of parking. Step off the strip because Vegas has so much more to offer! Seriously, check this place out!!!  Bonus: This place is on the way to Red Rock Canyon so it's super convenient for visitors.

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old School (eggs, amazing sausage, and those are yummy, crunchy smashed potatoes in the center)

-wFpAwDlNx68eolk1T3c2w.text: The perfect place for brunch. Great atmosphere, amazing food, and aesthetic plates. It also wasnt as packed as I expected it be at 11am. I had ordered the Corned Beef Smash, after a recommendation from the cashier, and French Toast and my date got the Bacon Old School and Acai Bowl. The food was amazing, we devoured every bite. The corned beef had amazing texture and flavors and the potatoes were well seasoned. The French toast was amazing flavors also, nice hint of cinnamon and texture was great. While the old school was very plain with just eggs, bacon, potatoes, and side salad, it was well balance. The highlight was definitely the acai bowl which had the right amount of everything in every bite. If I had one criticism is that it is a little pricey; our orders came to a total of $50+ and while the taste and flavors were there, brunch seemed too overpriced.

l4W2wDSaqCvYX1MQviLMXA.text: Cute place..  the food was soooo good!!!  I don't know why I've never had coconut pancakes before!  The only issue was the girl who took our order seemed like she really hates her job.. we had some questions about the coffees and she was clearly irritated.  After us, someone else took over the order/cash register.  We kept watching her and she kept the angry face during everything she did..  lol.  I didn't take away a star, 'cause we all have bad days AND the food definitely made up for it!

8Szo768s4Lc3_YQ4tktROw.text: So glad I decided to come in, heard so many great things about this place! And everything was exactly what we expected and more. The food was amazing, and smoothies were tasteful.  Def one to come back to for seconds!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich, Coconut Pancakes , Tropicool Smoothie

ikASSLSEDHH_rAi3ISIl7Q.text: I came to Neighbors on a Saturday @ 9:30 to meet some friends for brunch. I was worried because the line was almost out the door when I arrived. After waiting in line for around 5 minutes I put in my order, paid, and joined my gal pals at a central table. I liked the simple decor, the potted plants, and the dark tables. I feared we were going to have a long wait until the food was brought out, but I was pleasantly surprised when everything came out all together in just a few short minutes.  There was a ton of staff members who you could tell all worked like a well oiled machine.  My food was light, colorful, and tasty. I left very full and satisfied.  Parking was a bit tight-luckily there was a dirt lot for overflow. And the acustics were crazy in there. I could hardly hear the conversation at my table.

TPJSqaGvBW5Rj8SfkCzLRw.text: I really enjoyed my experience at Neighbors. Tucked into a small complex, I wasn't sure I was in the right place but once I walked I side and saw all the plants, I knew I made it.  There are lots of seats and you order at the counter here. I opted for the Shakshuka which are eggs baked in a rich tomato sauce and a cinnamon roll because, well, do you know me? I can never turn down a cinnamon roll. My gal pal opted for the French toast and we added a side of bacon because, bacon!     Everything was delicious and the staff is walking around to help you if you need anything while you're seated. I wouldn't say this was my favorite brunchy spot in Vegas but it's definitely up there and super delicious.

uB5ccFbYWH-x6j7gCctz4A.text: First time here at Neighbors, it was quite a far drive from Henderson but it was worth it! Very spacious restaurant with the convience of getting your own utensils, water and sauces. We ordered quite a few dishes, all was delicious! Corn beef hash was super tender with the sunny side egg, french toast was light and fluffy, it was not overly sweet which is a plus, shakshuka had lots of flavor but need more toast to dip in that red sauce! Salmon toast was light and crispy, I didn't try the beet salad but my brother seem to enjoy it a lot. Would definitely come again to try something else on the menu!

ztWoSkheaL6XJ5nJ2iYKLQ.text: A breakfast/brunch spot that is hot with many with my friends...they're A-OK with me...!  Neighbors service: Sunday lunch visit, party of 6 of which half were kids and it was busy.  You fall in line, order up and they bring your order to the table as you seat yourself.  The wait staff was friendly and the kitchen gets your order to the table quickly.  Very efficient process.  However, any assistance after you get your food requires you having to come up to the front cashier area.  You get your own dining setup, refill your own water, get you own condiments, etc. as a dedicated server is not assigned to your table.  I'm cool with this but just an FYI.  Also, it's  first come first serve when it comes to seating. Think of a sweet tomatoes service setup without the all you can eat option.  Neighbors cuisine:  The breakfast sandwich was small in size but big in flavor.  The salad sided with it was very fresh and tasty.  It could definitely stand alone if need be.  My latte was tasty and comes adorned with a flower graphic on the top.  The BBF's avocado toast looked tasty but came on one medium piece of bread, great presentation though.  The old school had heartier servings and my friend took it down quickly because it was flavorful.  Neighbors ambiance:  Potted plants adorn the this boutique cafe and the plant wall in the back is very cool. White walls and ceilings with a minimalist styling makes a for a visually pleasant dining area.  However, the acoustics of the area make it very noisy.  To the point where you definitely have to raise your voice for conversation if it open dining area starts getting busy.    There isn't dedicated table service and it's very noisy but the staff is great and the food is tasty. There are more dishes on the menu I'd definitely like to sample next time I'm in the area, but that's another Yelp tale.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sJNHRg-5FHPLBA5qffDYbg.text: I love Neighbors and I can't believe I haven't written a review yet. Neighbors is one of my favorite places to go for breakfast and brunch. There was a point in time that I think I went every weekend.   Salmon toast- I liked it better than the avocado toast. The smoked salmon was delish and the bread didn't get soggy.    Avocado toast- flavorful but I could easily make it at home is how I saw it   French toast- probably one of my go tos as I love the honey butter and the granola. Can I just eat those two things together if it didn't clog up my arteries? Lol. The bread isn't soggy and it had the right amount of egg wash.   Breakfast burrito- hearty but a good ratio of sausage and eggs to potatoes. I would def recommend putting some hot sauce on it too.   The one thing that surprised me was the portobello burger. Hearty and lots of fries if you love fries. The bread was a little much for me but I try to eat less carbs sometimes.   Overall, food is great and service is good. It can get backed up when it's busy but it's worth the wait or the postmates if that's how you want to roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Swiss burger!

duwFr1awp6LbdNSA8Knt-Q.text: I LOVE this place, and that's not a sentiment for me to express lightly.    As far as cafes go, Neighbors is so much more than that and they do it absolutely right.  I've been here a few times now & every experience has been exceptional.  Their food is fantastic.  Well-prepared, well-seasoned high-quality ingredients & their coffee and beverage menu goes beyond your standard lattes and cold brews.  The ambiance is light, clean and minimal.  The only indulgence to the decor is the generously spread potted plants, making you feel more like you're on a rooftop terrace than in a nondescript parking lot in Las Vegas.  In a desert city of excess that lacks cool, casual refinement, Neighbors is an oasis.

6PNgTxHNqWhtpZpDTzolZg.text: I've been eyeing neighbors for a while but haven't had a chance to go until today. We went for a quick breakfast on our way to the airport with the hubs.   Upon walking inside, we were immediately treated by the cashier. She handed us menus and let us know she was happy to answer any questions. We decided on the breakfast burrito & sandwich with vanilla lattes. We paid & got our table name sign and found a table.   While we waited, I noticed the restaurant is so bright, open & clean. I absolutely love all of the plants & succulents everywhere!   Even though it is a self service establishment, the "servers" brought our drinks, food & checked on us multiple times to see how we liked the food, drinks and came by again after we were done to clear away the plates & cups.   Everything was delicious. We will definitely be back again. I also love how they have a kids menu.

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich

i1L4FJXVJNvvUPGUsG68bQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere and service. Reasonable prices. The breakfast is served all day and I really enjoyed my Old School Meal. Red potatoes, sausage, greens, and eggs! My wife liked the mushroom Swiss burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old School Meal
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Muffin

jw0nGMUeL9YN2XOYzBUOLg.text: Just had to see what this new spot was all about. After this first visit, I knew I'll be coming back again.   Neighbors is literally a "neighborhood" spot tucked into the Southwest of Vegas. Careful not to drive past it because of its sort-of discreet driveway. Get here early! - We came in on Saturday morning around 10:30 and it was packed!   Tip: because of its self-seating dining area, have someone in your group first grab a table before they're all taken.  When you walk in, you'll find a line formed in front of the cashier who takes your order and hands you the number & stand to place on your table - only instead of a number it's your handwritten name.   On this sunny August morning, there was a Summer Menu, so not only was I ordering from it today, it also made me wonder if there's a Fall menu,... or Winter, or Spring.   I went with the Protein Bowl ($8) which includes quinoa, eggplant, mushrooms, and your choice of tofu (+$2), chicken (+$3), steak (+$5), or my choice, grilled salmon (+$6). With the salmon option you even have the choice of how you want it cooked; I would've gone for the well-done but I wanted to try the medium and it did not disappoint! The portion was also very generous. I mixed up everything together and didn't waste a bite!  I only wish that I lived closer. I want to try everything on the summer menu so that I can make my way to the regular one.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein Bowl (w/ Grilled Salmon $14; Summer Menu)
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein Bowl (w/ Grilled Salmon $14; Summer Menu)

mwAowrGgD6Sh_G7ljUl5kQ.text: I'll give them 2 stars for being a healthier option, but that's it. They overcharge for what you get. Lavender or mint lemonade is not infused with either. They literally drop a bunch of lavender or mint in your lemonade and that it, so you don't even taste it, all for $4?!! It's not even an efficient use of their time! We witnessed people getting one drink at a time from the servers, then burgers coming out before pancakes, at the same table!! No efficiency here whatsoever. My husband got a chicken sandwich and I got the sweet beets salad, to go...took 45 minutes!! Definitely not worth the wait. Like another review stated, it's like going to a friend's house and they made you lunch, whoopee Dee! I'd rather go to Vic Vegas's place for a sandwich where it's good and does not take this long! Never coming back. My time is more valuable.

y6EyfNsEo_vKmgYdexn9zg.text: This place is great! They have vegan and vegetarian options, the food is really good as well as service. Its definitely a must try.  Coffee  is super strong tho'. I was jumping All over the place and happy joy joy for a few hours. I feel like was Bzzzzzzzzzz  and talking 100 miles an hour. Lol. Its all good ... it seems like a i did a work out in a different way. BuT seriously, stop by this place and and try. Good food! Oh yea, The guy ( PAT)that tends the table is awesome ...oh boy was he working so fast and he is all about it. Maybe we had the same coffee heheheeh! He is great, i needed to do that shout out. Have a great neighborly day!

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian option they also have vegan

2kX1YpbFcgKq8qxV8FHhHA.text: Wow this place is amazing .. our first time here and we feel like ordering all the menu. We order shakshoka, Beet salad and frittata. Everything was good. We are coming back for sure.

gOjLMdSAUxk9IX8cHzfOCg.text: I work down the street and always drive by this place I never thought of even trying it. So today I brought a new flavor of oatmeal to work but it tasted like paste so and I was hangry so I needed a quick breakfast. I found this place on postmates (free delivery) and lemme tell ya, this breakfast sandwich was the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had. I substituted the sausage for extra bacon. I will definitely be back to try the other food at this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich from postmates

5wzwArhmL0-ViDeHjK_5Dg.text: I love their avo toast with smoked salmon and the white mocha. Loved the decorations here too. Great place for breakfast.

lIxw0zDlWjS7n0w2AbOgOA.text: Love this place! In a little bit of an off the beaten path location but once you find it you know because of all the plants in and around the restaurant! Food came quick, hot and was delicious!! It's not cheap by any means, but that's because you get great quality food prepared excellently

xgppyepkE7Nhl06S2v0Kxg.text: Lovely decor and comfortable atmosphere. Service was good and the kitchen was SUPER fast. Downsides- almost no vegan options if you can't tolerate avocado/banana like me. The cashier made a very poor suggestion of the Shakushka minus the eggs, cheese and bread.. which leaves basically just tomato sauce and garnish. Tasty tomato sauce, but not much else. I went back up and ordered potato's to bulk it up, but it ended up being just rather pricy sauce. My partner's mushroom burger was tasty but on the soggy side.   If you are omni or just vegetarian, you'll definitely enjoy this place. If I go back I'll stick to coffee and a side of fruit, thanks.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soy flat white

esLqGppi59daErvjEZkHeg.text: Great meal at Neighbors! Trendy coffee shop/cafe with yummy food and some great looking drinks. The kale caesar salad with added salmon was deliciously filling, yet still light and refreshing!  As some others have said, the space is an open floor plan so the noise of other tables can make it a little loud to hear at times, but this didn't really impact my experience too much.  I will definitely be back to try more and I would recommend to anyone looking for great feel-good food in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5rftmrrk4fCa9tbPQCCSYA.text: If you're ever in the mood for a good old-fashioned breakfast this is your spot. The environment is super clean and very hip. It's a great place to grab breakfast with friends or by yourself. Definitely have the Matcha tea latte.

2D6XD4mnlVUQL__rfc0XKQ.text: Found this delicious food while out running errands. Was extremely satisfied. Food quality yummy, service excellent, cleanliness A+, price well worth the quality. Will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So cute when you walk in love the decor
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito, smashed potatoes, acaii bowl n original bacon eggs n few greens.

SD-KifFPQUBoRonJ7I6ntw.text: We were so excited to finally try this place.  The parking lot was always full so we dove in after months of seeing its success.  I got over the order at the counter process with handheld menus.  I tried the frittata with chorizo. Not my favorite but my fiance loved his burrito especially the sauce.  The second time we got burritos to go as I don't love the atmosphere. It's clean but loud, serve yourself anyway.  I thought I loved the burrito but found the sauce over powering. The third and fourth times the burritos were greasy. I've decided the cost is not reasonable, and I apparently don't love the flavor combinations.  It's on our list but we don't go often.

oKgvUr9MhQ06IGkb9e_aLA.text: There are many 'Healthy' food restaurants all around Las Vegas, but most of them serve some of the most bland foods. Neighbors is not one of them.... Their menu offers healthy varieties for your morning brunch and they taste amazing. The steak and eggs as well as the cinnamon rolls are some of the best in town!

EyCVUGIO8isORie4ysOhhQ.text: I went there on Saturday morning, it was full in the main area, kids were running and screaming, it's dangerous if the kids bumping into the staffs with food. I sit in the other side, where was much quite. The sandwich was delicious, coffee was average. Overall it's a nice place to have brunch with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat White

ArRmaGSwlg-KIv0C_6eflg.text: I would give this place more of a 3.5 stars. Super noisy here, it's difficult to hold a conversation without pausing to wonder if the person you're talking to can hear you, because you can't even hear yourself.  I ordered ... to try and it tasted great! Until a few minutes in.. my egg was burnt on the bottom and the top layer was getting over cooked and not tasting as pleasant anymore.  Would not suggest getting this if you don't like overcooked/burnt eggs.  My friend ordered, and hers was a bit flavorless, but her cast iron wasn't as hot as mine and didn't have overcooked/burnt eggs. Interior is bright, simple and a lovely place to enjoy a meal if it weren't for the noise problem.  I've been to places where it's busy, but the noise doesn't echo and amplify. I would love to come back and give their other items a try. Who doesn't love breakfast right? I just wouldn't think I'd come out of my way for this place, unless a friend wanted to go

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S7C01aV4NOo_D8xL1eFz-w.text: Great customer service, greeted as soon as you walk in. Love the plants everywhere and natural lighting. A little pricey but food is good. I ordered the breakfast burrito but the avocado crema was missing and definitely would have made it better, my partner had the BLATC which comes with fries and was very good. I would recommend the matcha latte and Nutella latte! Disappointed they have straws though. Everything else is reusable utensils or cups and then they give me a plastic straw. If they're gonna have straws get the paper or plant made ones!

h4fEu1hR7Nul3ZuT0X7NbA.text: Great restaurant and we live close by. But very disappointed in the service! They have been getting busier and good for them. The food is good.  I made a comment about the wait time time today and the woman at the cash register made a sarcastic comment and couldn't have cared less and then the lady making coffee rolled her eyes and made a face. I just asked to speak to the manager and the sever I asked hasn't even told him yet. There are plenty of places to eat in the area and sad to say I don't think I will be coming back here. Too bad...but if they don't care about customer service there is another place that will!

d2lLr3bMHo2DdVCZL3CFXw.text: Tucked away in a business complex on Fort Apache, Neighbors a new hidden gem! Came here earlier today and really enjoyed it!   Neighbors is a casual brunch/ lunch place with a very modern and chill vibe. You order your food at the front and seat yourself which would be my prime complaint- I definitely don't think this would be an effective practice especially if it's super busy, people may be discouraged at the fact that there are no tables nor specific waiting area.   We ordered the avocado toast and the old school. The avocado toast was very light and refreshing but definitely not filling as it only comes with one slice and a small side salad. The old school was your typical breakfast plate with bacon, eggs, potatoes, and your choice of toast. Overall, both were good- nothing exceptionally notable, but still good.     We ordered 2 coffees- an iced caramel latte and a regular drip. The regular coffee was very acidic and hard to drink even with an excess amount of half and half. The iced latte didn't have much of a coffee taste- I'd compare it to milk.   Overall, I'd return. The menu had a number of items that sounded delicious, the dining area was very aesthetic, food was good, and the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LWyWOipVnB89rYHY7w6nvQ.text: Neighbors is literally my neighbor. LOL I started to hear a lot of buzz and seeing cute photos so I  decided to check it out for a girls brunch.   We walked in and directly sat down thinking that they would take our order. But you actually order then they deliver your food. The service was kinda moderate. One server asked if we ordered our food, but didn't tell us we walk up to order.   Besides that, I asked about the kale salad and the vegetarian burger. The server suggested both were good, but vegetarian mushroom burger didn't come with a veggie patty.   So I went with the kale salad. It was good, but could of added more veggies since the plate to filling ratio wasn't enough.   Overall, cute place, but needs to work more on customer service and making sure everything is good. No one checked up on us after they delivered the orders. So everything is kind of self serve.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e3O3gCck2cAxtuDSqT0M8w.text: Great like always. Order again the steak and eggs. Husband order the chipotle sandwich and wow... it was really good. Love the coffee here. Tried the French toast and really liked the taste with the granola. It's worth the 15 min drive. This is my breakfast place.

j14b6n1EcFxBQyXOChAnSA.text: Ambiance: Very nice, bright and open space. Clean. Good for chatting.  Food: Great taste.  I had the salmon toast with salad.  Price: it's fair, meaning the food is worth the price. Expect to pay around $10-15 for a whole meal (drink & food).  Pretty good for my first time there.

DAHtje9rFW7xnXqFawJVsw.text: Stopped this morning with my girls.. first impression walking in the door was outstanding! Everyone was smiling and made direct eye contact. The place is well lit with lots of green plants spread around. A little art on the walls could really make it pop, but let's get right to the food.. Menu looked very unique, a mix of classic breakfast items with a few twists.. we ordered the chicken and waffles, breakfast burrito, breakfast sandwich on sourdough, and the French toast. Arriving at the table all portions were large in size and tabled to considerably please the eye.  French toast was out of this world. I'm not even a sweet breakfast food person and it blew my mind. I loved the subtle crunch of the added oats.  Breakfast sandwich and burrito were phenomenally executed.  The burrito was packed with hearty meat, potatoes, and a spicy mayo alongside, while the greens on the sandwich gave a very healthy crisp I wasn't expecting from a breakfast sandwich.   The chicken and waffles could have used a little work, as the waffles didn't really shine, but the breading on the chicken was amazing! I'd suggest a  chicken portion(s) with more meat? It came with two wing portions which made it feel a little weak.   Overall we loved it!!!! Friendly staff, bright open atmosphere, clean look, AND less than a block from my house?!?!  Great job guys!! I'll be back soon indeed.

X0vAjYQG-cSYJiDRTBUuxQ.text: Stayed in vegas at a friends recently and ordered delivery.  Top notch to say the least.
