dr66ajmRKQvHy1ItZMcp6g.text: Brunch with the fam. Great food with fresh ingredients. The pictures don't do justice for the excellent food. Casual atmosphere and could be a bit noisy. Excellent for families.

buP7e6kB8akKZLtk7DsYZA.text: I absolutely love this place. It serves great quality and delicious breakfast and lunch options. My favorite is EVERYTHING on the menu so far and I'm about half way through it. Definitely come by to check this place out!

Lnski8CAe_aZ1-S5h1vBNw.text: We are from Thousand Oaks, CA  and were looking for a late brunch place... what a pleasant surprise, Neighbors is!! Yummy skillet dishes and the cinnamon rolls are extreme goodness! The management and staff are super friendly. We will return when we are in town again!!

8AoMvc5eJ6eOMYcyqpKY9Q.text: I've been meaning to try this place for about three months. I'm so glad that I did. I was a little leery on counter service breakfast, I guess that's because I'm used to that being fast food. Nothing could be further from the truth with this place. I ordered the steak and eggs and was shocked at how flavorful and delicious the steak was. Everything was cooked perfectly, the service was wonderful, and the price was right. I've seen a review or two on here that are complaining about the price and I don't understand it. The prices are barely higher than Denny's or Village Inn and the quality is about 10 times better than either of those places. This is going to become a regular spot for me.

d80t1whbpGxzy6Mfypa65w.text: I recently discovered this place with my assistant and we weren't too sure how it would be since it's located in a small shopping center that looked more like a doctors office from the outside but once in the door you will see that it's a cute little spot! I love this place!!!!! Good food, good service & cool atmosphere

uZLpIWlezgVazh0fTSB20g.text: People tend to be slightly annoying aka a group of six that all need to make separate orders and payments, but food and staff are great.

WPsVEOgciWzb3FN0dFAzKw.text: This was our first time here and we were not impressed overall. You have to order at the counter and they ask for a tip up front. I would not have tipped after I understood that I would be the one making several trips to the front for silverware, condiments, and several small glasses of water. Their coffee was great and food was good, but was not happy to pick 6 small hairs out of our two plates of food. Would have been appropriately priced had they served us, but overpriced for self service. Will not be going back. There are much better breakfast/brunch places for the price in the area.

_v8OmAqz7dURP338yU6UYA.text: This is our new favorite breakfast/brunch spot! Lovely and clean inside. Perfect to get a meal or post up with your lab top. Everything from small dishes (oatmeal) to big dishes (French toast or breakfast burrito), to coffee drinks, is all well made and beautifully presented. It's like "woah that's really mine?!" ... next time I'll post a picture ;)

dt6j583eh2bDBQv9OQHtUg.text: One of the decent  places to get your breakfast from. I  was in a hurry asked them how long if I order now, 10 minutes they said but my order was ready in 5. Great service.  I'll be back. Thank you

yg_AkBoTY0U4R7aS4XWjyA.text: Shakshuka was very basic. Tasted like canned tomato sauce to me. Spice and ingredients were mediocre. Would come back and try something else maybe.

N1dr2C8s5SPpNAe79klcMw.text: We live close by, and I cannot believe we haven't been there before today. Wow. Yummy  and interesting food at a reasonable price. Even the standards are done with flair. My quesadilla looked more like a burrito, because it was so big. Not just mushrooms, but a combination of types. Not just sweet peppers, they are roasted. Many veggie options, and the choice to add meat or chicken if you wish. We will be going back often.

Dia-E10_pyJ59Mu5EwSiew.text: Nice place and awesome food. And it's only 4 mins away from my house. Will def come grab some food often. I always love the coffee from downtown Vesta, but it's too far from my house. I found Neighbors also use the coffee from vesta, so it's another plus! Hope they can have longer hours so I can come here in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pacific smoked salmon. The salad is really good too. Awesome vibe and perfect food! Love it! Will def come often

Zv8UTqRKgKJxPfxJn5smYg.text: Very Pretty. Hipster. I like the self serve part. But I did not like the food. The frittata was dry, being constructive here, maybe take it out of the cast iron. The shakshuka needed seasoning. First time my husband had to reach the salt and pepper. Coffee is meh. I know they are going for local stuff but as a breakfast place you gotta get the coffee right. They are new, we'll come back after a few months.

UcHRw7EnZZRdX9SOX58T4A.text: We wanted to try some place new, and we were out this way! The coffee shop and grill is very clean and cafeteria style. I liked all the live plants and non smoking features. We both ordered burgers and they were 5/5 stars delicious.

hvFAeRHai3b_3PL9Fp44Yw.text: Awesome atmosphere. Friendly service. My husband and I shared the breakfast burrito and the coconut pancakes- so freaking good! Mint lemonade was perfect. Husband liked his matcha tea. And affogato to end which was also amazing! Super impressed with this place and can't wait to come back!

ILVU65PGBwCbPRjo5PilDg.text: This place has an excellent vibe the minute you step in the door. It is setup as social seating and very inviting. It can get noisy, but it's a jovial environment to meet new people!  The menu has just enough to not be overwhelming, but still offer plenty of options. The staff is extremely friendly and the service is fast! Had the Pina burger today and it was cooked just right! The combination of flavors with the beef, beets, pineapple and egg is on point! More flavors to come!

FJY1jtBQTKgUNgA4qrSBrA.text: Had the Old School breakfast this morning with locally brewed Vesta coffee. Great friendly service. Breakfast was great. Coffee in point.  Great place for a breakfast meeting with colleagues.

MLCw83x3uSafE8Z5w8Olag.text: I met my girlfriend here for breakfast. Their menu is interesting but I found their portion sizes too small and unsatisfying. Also food is okay, nothing to rave about. Probably won't return.

zKwI4xDu6sSL5Ji-7CJzog.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. The staff was so sweet, the restaurant was so beautiful and the food was beyond delish! Will be back many more times!

PD0ygztCTo8XEshePaXR3w.text: Best acai bowl in town! Steak and eggs is great as well as the breakfast sandwich. Love the decor and atmosphere too!

Rof4PLqqQ-xxDJDfy-Dgpg.text: Great food and service, loved the atmosphere. Good selection.  Many new meun items and choice's

NNrJDgQq-n3YU55ARhiSTQ.text: This place is so cute! Loved the vibe, so many plants! I thought the menu was a little small and nothing really caught my eye so I just went with a safe choice and got the bacon burger. It was a great burger though! I also ordered a latte which was pretty tasty.

_8tmIfL7lGFgeqdXmQM2OA.text: Worst place ever, a breakfast place that doesn't have a kids eggs. Service is horrible. Food was lacking taste just very ordinary. Plating for food is sloppy.

9bJdXYOy1UeqKYiRARg8tQ.text: Their smashed potatoes were good. Breakfast burrito surprisingly good with the chipotle sauce. You can order the waffle in the kid's menu. For $5.5, it's a steal!

ZZ_IrWe6OALwKV65tvc8WQ.text: Cute place and the food was good. Loved that they had a kids menu. The staff was friendly and it wasn't too busy or noisy.

QfrS9rUc5SNjnGo7mYLe0w.text: Overall the property offers a great setting and decent breakfast food for all.  Yet for picky eaters or vegans, those who have high service standards and concerned about pricing to satisfaction, you won't be impressed.  Lately many of these places have done this, setting, and presentation is best, and service is subpar and food is average and overpriced.  Depending on what you value most or what your preferences are, Neighbors will fancy you differently.  The music, the ambiance, real plants, open space, large windows for sunlight, the fancy and small centerpiece plants, plates and silverware, the cool chalk board name plates for your orders are all pretty welcoming and neat.  I really enjoy a sunny and home feel to restaurants.  Especially these new and niche places that seem like home.  The funny thing is lots of the younger crowds don't have nice homes, or cook, or anything, so that's why nowadays a lot of these business just look and cook meals that represent something your family cooks.  The food comes out pretty and nice.  For younger people in the teenager to late 30s, you won't be bothered and will be satisfied with every aspect of this business.  Anyone who cooks or shops often or has a high standard of service, you'll constantly be asking yourself, or the staff questions here and there about, "where's my order again?" or, "I didn't ask for that.  Can ya remake it?"    I personally dislike wasting food for them to throw it away cuz of a mistake.  Yet it happened a few times in one visit and other visits.  Its cool cuz they compensate the wait or the honest mistake with more food.    For those who seek vegetarian options, this place is very friendly.  They still have steak and eggs for the others.  For vegans there are few, very few options.  Whenever you ask to make em that way they say they can't.  You watch them make it from scratch and wonder why they can't.  Sometimes when they do, they'll still botch or forget.  I don't wanna ramble on but the verdict is, I had mixed feelings on my visits here.  If you're here to chat to a friend it's perfect.  Semi health concerns, wanna eat steak and eggs but wanna make it kinda healthy?  Sure, it's great.  Vegetarians that want to have a quick meal?  Yeah it's dope.  Vegans, people who want the best in the food and the price and service, will be whatever about it.  You'd go here if someone wants to, but you, yourself, will never recommend or decide to come here on your own.  I'd say try it once and give it a shot, because many people who review or come here will strongly disagree with me.

MY93U-07FltVxNgC3gQTJg.text: Our food took forever to come out. Wasn't impressed with my avocado toast it was very cold and coffee was okay.

HoHJGY0t4V4pRB1SknANzQ.text: Great food and lovely environment. Delicious large portions that will keep you full for a few hours.

SL5gmKpgR0Yao6fRW-1UjA.text: This place has the best teas! My daughter loved their fries and sweet potato fries. I loves how the atmosphere was very welcoming and the deco definitely gave it a good vibe. Will definitely be coming back to this place.

0Zk70r22gIsEEX67U4i1dg.text: I don't understand how this place could possibly have a bad review! I've been here twice this week and everything I've tried has been amazing. The queen bee and matcha latte are some of the best I've had.

5PrGwjeapcKuuJ-j7t8iRw.text: Very cool little restaurant. Food was very good and the ambiance is great. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, and the food will bring us back.

o90BDTpM6XrRdtHXsfbpjg.text: I don't eat out a lot, I am a good cook and I have kids, so for me to spend money on something I can do as well or better is disappointing.  The positives- really cute atmosphere and decor, food was good enough. I had avo toast and coffee. The poached egg was very underdone, toast was nice and avocado was perfectly ripe, the side of lettuce was strange though, just a sprinkle of pumpkin seeds; I wasn't sure what to do with it, put it on my toast too?  Coffee was too strong and the complementary water tasted like tap.  For nearly $15 I could have made all 4 of my family members the same EXACT breakfast and better coffee.  If you don't cook and don't care what you spend, this place is ok.

Wv25fHXrDnjuzP0_NmMAmA.text: Shakshuka was really good! Also mushroom medley quesadilla! Definitely want to try out other items on their menu

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shakshuka
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom medley quesadilla

JRWJxgG1KNMEJvDDp1Khlw.text: Neighbors is an amazing restaurant. We came here for lunch and really enjoyed everything from the food to the atmosphere. The avocado toast, bacon cheese burger, and steak and eggs were all excellent. We will definitely frequent Neighbors:)

ViycKP1ye1309LBlKSEOEg.text: I like the place, staff are nice, good food and definitely good coffee. But this place could be very crowded though.

mcJJb0BgIzVODYk_Z3hCJw.text: When you walk in you are greeted by a server and a handful of live green plants. Atmosphere is very upbeat and inviting. The food was great and you could tell it was made from fresh ingredients. Highly recommend eating breakfast or lunch at neighbors.

D_uKGFeXIUsnTTxxhjRqwg.text: Steak and eggs were so good I had to come back two days later for round 2! The restaurant itself is very cute and clean. It has a very modern and contemporary feel. Love the overall atmosphere. Be advised the wait may be a lot longer on weekends. Today, on Sunday we had to wait in line for a while to order and also wait even longer after for food to come, but overall another delicious and satisfying experience. I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!

WLTDLBjTNiKBCFSBlCbjOQ.text: went yesterday and got a capp, avo toast, and side of smoked salmon for $19. it took about 15 minutes and it was good. everything about the experience was pretty good, but i'm disappointed that this has become the standard, especially considering how it has an almost perfect rating.  the concept is order at the counter and they bring it to you. i asked the woman at the register what was good since it was my first time. she recommended a dish and the only description offered was that it was gluten free and vegan, which it stated on the menu. i ordered and paid, and she flips the screen around to have me choose a gratuity and sign. the four options are 25%, 20%, 18%, or "other." in no way do i blame employees for trying to get tips, especially when establishments pay employees as little as possible. but it's counter service. and we live in a world where 15% is the standard, and 20% is for good service.   the food comes and it's the wrong order. not by much - instead of a side of smoked salmon they brought the whole salmon toast dish (perhaps explaining why it took 15 minutes for a minimal order). i said i didn't order the dish, just a small side, and asked if i was charged for the dish or the side. he apologized, took the dish back, and said he'd find out. 5 minutes later he brought back the side of salmon. he didn't say anything else, and the portion was one slice of smoked salmon (nicely  presented, kind of wrapped around itself), and if i had to guess, it was about 1.5 oz. i guess they threw out the rest of the dish or an employee ate it.   i started to look around and saw a few dirty tables, two guests who had been done for awhile with dirty plates in front of them, and A LOT of employees (maybe 12 guests seated total). i then watched some employees gathered at the expo line enjoying themselves, and one appeared to be a manager since he was dressed in regular clothes and was standing there the entire time.   like i said, everything was good, and overall the place was fine. but for those prices (and the expectations of significant gratuity)... is this the standard for what we think is great? i've been in hospitality for 20 years as a server and a manager, either working for gratuity or supporting my servers to get as much gratuity as possible. this newly opened restaurant, its employees, and (i am assuming) it's manager, had maybe 3 or 4 opportunities to make this better and they chose to not take advantage of any of them, which will probably make it harder to swallow paying $19 and (a somewhat forced) tip of 15% for a capp, avo toast, and 1.5 oz of smoked salmon. and everyone else thought it was 5 stars.

adbxzJfYoujy2w7tt3ysMw.text: Awesome addition to the neighborhood! We ordered after a short wait in line. We were quickly served our drinks. The fresh squeezed orange juice was just the way I like- pulpy and sweet. We both ordered the "Old School" two eggs, bacon, toast, smashed potatoes and with greens I substituted the potatoes for fruit which was melon and cantaloupe which were perfectly ripe. The toast was a super hearty whole grain. Not your normal Wonder bread wheat. My BF, who knows me so well, gave me one of his smashed potatoes. It was perfect!  Crunchy on the outside and fluffy in the center with just the right amount of salt.   I love the bright decor- white tile and concrete floors.  It is very lively AKA loud. Would not recommend for anyone who has difficulty hearing.  We took a couple of peanut butter cookies to go. They offered to heat them but we are saving them for our Sunday exploring. The burgers looked good.  Will be back to try other items.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old School
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunshine and fresh squeezed oj

zgWOVZjmkexOzB3fKRKR4g.text: I tried giving Neighbors a second chance because their food here is fantastic, but even the second visit the service was not one to bring me back. The first time I came, I walked in a waited a few seconds to realize that you order at the counter. I walk up and one of the girls looks at me and says "what do you want?", I was astonished on how rudely mannered she was.  I let her know I have never been here before and if she could guide me on how things worked. She just pointed at the counter and said "order here" and walked away.  I knew I should've left but I always try and give any place a chance, I ordered my food, I got a breakfast burrito; which the burrito was amazing and had so much flavor.  Overall first time experience, the service was bad but the food was good.   My second visit, I decided to order to-go through grub hub because I wanted to grab something before work.  I order online and go in about 15 minutes after I order. Both my boyfriend and I wait to get someone's attention, and my boyfriend tells them he has a pick up.   The guy who gave him the to go order just handed it to my boyfriend and said "thanks you, bye". My boyfriend wanted to order a drink but the young man did not even act like he cared. He waited by the counter, got his drink and we left.   Honestly the food here is fantastic, but the service is what makes us stray away. I would rather order to go then to sit in that place and be treated like that every time. Maybe I'll give them another chance, but not any time soon.

S_9A3-3NjX7XTAL7FQlT3g.text: One of the best breakfast places in town! Service is great, and the food doesn't take too long even when it's super busy on a Saturday morning.

RNaYGZZ2oOvVbpgSOT5S7w.text: Stumbled on this place because the place close to our house opens at 7am. We got there early today around 630am and was blown away by the food. I ordered a breakfast sandwich and my wife had a breakfast burrito. Both were top notch! I was a little confused because it was my first time there. You order at the counter, they have empty glasses right next to the counter, you're supposed to grab your own and take your own water to your table.  Once finishing your food, just leave the plates at the table.  Everyone was nice and smiling.  I'm optimistic about this place being my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas!

6ldOluW8yEIkFY1qn93Nzg.text: This is my new favorite brunch place! Not only is the staff friendly, helpful and FAST, but the food is reasonably priced for larger portions than I expected and the decor and ambiance of the restaurant is super cute.   Affogato:  YUMMMMM. Iced Tea: Refreshing Old School: Scrambled eggs, crispy bacon with multigrain bread and jam.... SO YUM.  I'm a simple breakfast person. But I appreciated the plating as well as how fast they were given how busy it was!  Overall:  loved it.  The staff makes you feel so comfortable, chairs are SO comfy that it made my 2.5 hr stay so enjoyable.    I highly recommend and will DEFINITELY be back. Follow them on IG: @neighborscafelv

cdVHVF6ArLtNnUEope_6-g.text: This is my new favorite brunch place! It's the cutest and it's so aesthetically pleasing. It's very modern and simplistic with a lot of little plants :-) Got to sit at a table by the wall of plants, which also might be the best place to sit. Lighting is also BOMB. Your photos will look very aesthetic.  I'm not a fan of burritos and it's definitely not my first choice, but the breakfast burrito sounded good and the pictures on their Yelp page made it look good. Ended up trying it and loved it! I put some Tapatio sauce on the burrito, which made it even better. It's a huge burrito and I had to take the other half home. I also tried their iced matcha latte. This is probably my new favorite matcha latte that I've had. I've been to places where I could barely taste the matcha green tea and it would be just mostly milk, but it was a good balance of matcha to milk.  Definitely will be here more often and will probably try a burger next.  ***************************  Update: Tried the bacon burger. Favorite bacon cheeseburger, ever. I also got it with sweet potato fries. Get it with sweet potato fries, you won't regret it.

When You walk in, not only are you greeted by the refreshing view of many lush green plants, but also the warm friendly smiles of the staff!  The front cashier was upbeat and fabulous.   The food!!!  Soooooooo amazing and fresh!!  They paid close attention to our special requests and the food was nice and hot.  The potatoes in the breakfast burrito tasted just like my grandma used to make! yzJg-uNG0kxOPL9xRcBr9A.text: This brunch place feels like it belongs in LA more than Vegas... but with Vegas pricing!  It's such a cute restaurant that has a big open airy space, big tables and amazing food.   I got the breakfast sandwich and my boyfriend got the mushroom burger. I got the side salad with my sandwich and he had the fries. I loved the food!  Both were great but the breakfast sandwich in my opinion was my favorite. It's a huge portion for only 8 bucks!  Thee chipotle mayo on it complemented the egg, sausage and bacon. The salad was light and went perfectly well with the heavier sandwich.   The mushroom burger was also super juicy and flavorful and the fries were super thin and crispy.. exactly the way I like it.   Will definitely be back to try more of the menu.  It's currently my favorite brunch spot in Vegas!

IphTf4zc0e7syCNq-4QVfg.text: Food and beverages are usually pretty good.  Customer service in person is usually pretty good.  This review is because of the oddly rude customer service over the phone.  I had gone in about a week ago and was told they had stopped serving their summer menu about a week prior.  Which was a bummer because there were a couple items I had wanted to try, but that's fine.  So today, I go to their website to see their fall menu.  Nothing.  They only have their summer menu, which is confusing, because they had stopped their summer menu in-store a few weeks ago.  So I call them, and ask if they are still serving their summer menu, and I am told they are not.  I ask them if they have their fall menu in-store, and am told they do.  I let them know that their website does not have their fall menu, and that it erroneously has their summer menu.  At this point, a bit of annoyance creeps into the person's voice and she says that they can't change the website because the owner isn't in and they have been busy.  Which makes no sense, because that means for at least 2+ weeks, they have been too busy to update their website?  I ask how I can see their fall menu, and am told it is on their Instagram profile.  I thank her, and we hang up the phone.  I do a Google search for "Instagram Neighbors Las Vegas" and click on the first link, which shows a bunch of pictures that don't have a menu anywhere.  So I call back, get the same person, and ask her how to get to the menu.  She says I have to go to the Instagram page.  I explain how it is not showing up when I search for it.  She says she doesn't know their username and gets her phone out to find it.  Throughout, she sounds annoyed.  She tells me what their username is, and I go to their page, and it says at the top that the fall menu is coming soon.  I tell her that their profile says the fall menu is coming soon, and she says that they haven't had a chance to update that.  Which makes no sense, because according to her, the menu is on their page, so she's telling me that they've had a chance to update their profile with the menu but not the part that says the fall menu isn't here yet?  She says the menu is available as a story, but that means I have to log in or create an account, just to view their menu.  Here's what I don't get.  Why is an employee annoyed with me when all I want to do is look at the menu?  How is it my fault that they have a website that has their summer menu, but no fall menu, even though in-store, they only have the fall menu?  How is it my fault that a Google search for their Instagram page doesn't come up with their Instagram page?  How is it my fault their Instagram page says their fall menu is coming soon when apparently it's actually available, but only if you have an Instagram account and are logged into it?

5SMz6cd3_UNomKSDp4Nt_w.text: Of the bat this place is aesthetically pleasing. Walking in, you're greeted with greenery and open space. It's cafeteria style where you order and find your own seating.   I ordered the Shakshuka- super delicious, spicy and a bit tangy from the feta cheese. It also comes with your choice of bread.   Drinks- I also ordered London fog ( a little too sweet for my taste buds but I still enjoyed it)  Green tea matcha latte- highly recommend if you love your green tea not sweet. All preference.    Would love to come back and try more

40LRCKmu5f3NFgJQuov3EQ.text: I loathe when you order a Matcha Latte & you are basically drinking sugary steamed milk. The Matcha Latte I ordered, was perfect! Seriously, probably the best one I've had period. It was slightly sweetened to not over power the matcha flavor and that's what I want when I order one.  I'm a sucker for anything lemon. Seeing that their coconut pancakes had a berry lemon syrup it was a must order for me. This entire dish tasted so fresh, which sounds crazy to say about pancakes, but they were light and fluffy & the berry lemon syrup, packed with blueberries, had me wanting to lick the plate clean.   Do I think they are bit overpriced for their concept (order at a counter & the food is brought to you)? Yes But, did they leave a solid first impression for me to want to return? YES

zhYk0aPlTQFNUbPYg1qt_Q.text: I brought my coworkers and boss here for a light lunch and was pleasantly surprised. When you walk in, you're greeted by fresh succulents and bright white walls (perfect for Instagram as you'll see in my photos), the right amount of natural light, and a walk-up counter to order your food.   I ordered the Chicks and Waffles and a Matcha Latte. The Chicks were perfectly fried, not too fatty, and came with a fluffy waffle and a sweet chili maple syrup. The Matcha wasn't overly sweet and they were able to substitute almond or soy milk instead of regular. Yay!  My coworkers and I were all happy with our visit, and I'll probably be bringing my husband here soon.   PS shoutout to Matt, the very kind and helpful food runner / server!

HTJaWd-YAulpIfCU9XRY1g.text: Hubby had been to Neighbors before but I wanted to experience the establishment and formulate my own opinion.  We got there around 11:15 and I was told to choose from the menu sitting on the counter and then order from the cashier.  The food would be delivered to our table.  I ordered the French toast with an iced coffee.  Husband ordered the Steak and Egg combo, a bowl of corn chowder and a strawberry lemonade.   When I heard the cashier state the price ($44.38), I was sticker shocked.  Husband paid for our meal and we sat at a table with our place card displayed.  My French toast arrived but I was a little disappointed.  Not in the actual (3) large and thick golden French toast slices, but seeing the large chunk of almost 2" of pure butter on top of the top piece and the disappointing lack of strawberries that was advertised.  The menu said the French toast came with "strawberries".  I saw (5) thinly cut strawberry slices that if you were to glue them back together, you'd have one whole strawberry.  This was almost a joke to me that was not funny.  There was a small sprinkling of the homemade granola over the top of the French toast slices and around the plate, the granola tasted good.  Overall, my French toast tasted good and I was not disappointed in the quality, I just wished I had several more strawberries and more granola.  Hubby's steak and eggs and then his corn chowder was reviewed in his Yelp review.  I will just add today's picture in my review.   What I really didn't care for at this restaurant was the lack of staff/customer interaction.  I had never been here and I didn't know that I had to basically fend for myself.  I felt that self service was kind of "fast food'ish" and it didn't seem to match the upscale and modern/hip vibe I was feeling from this place.  I had to keep getting up from my table to get assorted items from the self serve counter.  Silverware.  Salt/pepper.  Ketchup.  Napkins.  To-go box.  Definitely a "no frills" type of service...a little different set of rules of customer service then what I was expecting.  The interior of this establishment was a little open and noisy for my taste, I was having a hard time hearing fully what my husband was saying.  The openness and concrete floors, combined with the lack of sound absorbing decor/walls didn't provide me with a comfort that I think of when I hear "neighbors".  I'm not sure I would be returning to Neighbors, as I feel the overall experience did not match the price we paid today.

I went around 12pm on a Monday and it was packed! I think we waited about 10 minutes in line. There wasn't that much seats available, but thankfully we were able to find seats right away. Despite the business, I noticed that the workers are hard working and fast. After the group next to us left, a worker cleaned their table up only moments after.  I got the avo toast, which was perfect for my light appetite. I don't think it will satisfy those with a huge appetite, as it's only 1 slice with a light salad on the side. Tasty though! I also got an iced queen bee latte, which had the right amount sweetness, subtle but good.   All of the utensils, sauces, etc. are next to the cashier so there's not really any need to call a waitress to fetch you something. Also, they have steel straws, whic

With plenty of greenery and natural wood tones this place is great for Instagram, Yelp or any other social media to take pictures of your food.  I've been here a couple times and here's what I've ordered Corned Beef Smash, Shakshuka, Steak and Eggs, and the Blu-J smoothie. Honestly all of the food is amazing. myCSXVd0RSLdlHSYy-KICA.text: Cute little change to a breakfast joint! The atmosphere was a 5/5. It was quaint, with live green plants and a chill ambiance. First you order at the table then sit with your table marker for food to be delivered.  The overall setup was good, but I feel it took away from normal service. Because it was busy and you sit yourself, your responsible for your own water and drink refills. There's no problem with this, it's just a bit of a pain when busy.  In terms of the food, it was good overall. Great flavor in both meals. Nothing extraordinary but very good. I got the BLATC sandwich which was fresh, with yummy aioli and crispy bacon. My husband old school was good per his review.   Overall I'd recommend this place to friends and family, I just wish we got served. Serving would make it a little more low key and relaxing, so we could eat our meal.

v5GyAOVbIcyRO99IIN9sQw.text: My family and I went for breakfast on President's Day. The restaurant is located on the Southwest part of town, off the 215 & Russell in an area that looks like it would not be zoned for restaurants.   When we walked in, it looked like a chic brunch spot in Cali. You place your order at the counter, then they bring your food to your table. We ordered the following items:  Portoritto: B- (My husband was expecting more portobello mushrooms)  Breakfast burrito: B (Potatoes are in the burrito, so I didn't really need a side of smashed red potatoes. Wish there was more pico de Gallo)  Pancakes: A- (You get 4 heavenly pancakes)  Red smashed potatoes: C (Could have used more seasoning or maybe peppers?!)  Hot Chocolate with almond milk: B  Overall, I'd really give them 3.5 stars out of 5.

Y7_evgu_Rn_Af9FHzScuwg.text: Had breakfast there this morning with my wife.  It was okay, but nothing special and wildly overpriced for the value of the meal.  I had the steak and eggs and while the meat was tender and undercooked, it was full of fat and gristle.  Not very enjoyable.  My wife had two eggs and toast. The bill was $29 That's quite a bit for what we had and the lack of quality.  There are much closer and far better venues for much less cost here in northern Summerlin.  Don't think we'll return.

Gk6q5ymGZgMQS5SMFCAm2Q.text: I'm going to be completely honest. I have seen their sign for a while. I drive past them nearly every single day, as I live super close to this establishment. However, the building I see which is facing the street, has blacked out Windows. I have always thought that building WAS this business. It appeared as if there WAS NO BUSINESS. It wasn't until I searched Yelp for restaurants near me, that I saw Neighbors. So jumped in there to look at the Date of the last review. 3 days ago!! So the business is opened after all?? So my husband and I finally went!   Expectations: Restaurant where you get seated by a hostess and are waited on.  Reality: This is a fast-casual, hipster with Minimalism decor, establishment where you seat yourself and order your food at the counter. Everything is at the counter: silverware, napkins, drip coffee, creamer, salt & pepper, etc. , and the menus.  The decor was very nice. It was pretty loud in there. If you grabbed a table first before ordering, you felt the pressure of trying to decide what to eat as you watch the line grow longer and longer. Then, you have to leave you stuff at the table (or something to stake your claim) so that your table doesn't get nabbed.   The food was high quality and the presentation was beautiful! Plus, it tasted good too! But it felt a little chaotic, but that is ONLY because I expected being seated and staying seated. I had to keep getting up to order, grab silverware, grab napkins, grab my coffee, etc. That's not bad in itself. I just had different expectations for my first time.  I DO recommend this place! And I will be back! I'll post photos shortly.

8_LlxOIk4U3e7vFx6BaLhA.text: This is my 2nd visit at this place. The first time me & a friend visited, the place just opened and the food that we were served was pretty good, but now after awhile, on my second visit recently, I would say the food has stepped up a whole lot. I ordered the steak and eggs with chimichuri sauce and it was perfect. Steak was cooked perfectly and of course the eggs were cooked accordingly. Came with a bread and the lemon muffin was perfectly baked. It was Saturday morning and it was pretty busy.  Although the food was superb, my one star less is from the customer service I received today. I came to have breakfast with my two year old son and after I ordered, we sat by the window and my son sat on the pillow side, when the old lady server gave us our Lemon muffin and iced matcha, I kindly asked her if she can get us a glass of water because I don't want to leave my son alone in the chair, without hearing me completely, she immediately told me YOU CAN SERVE YOURSELF WITH WATER OVER THERE. I thought that was very rude especially after I mentioned to her I did not want to leave my son alone (2 year old) in the chair. I know it's a self serve that's why I asked nicely but she didn't bother to understand. Hope this help the owner or the manager to let the employees know that sometime there are circumstances that you should listen to the customer.   Hope that will change because we really support this place as

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; eggs with chichuri

QH2Tk2_bs5vynaxD2_EmQw.text: Neighbors is just OK. I feel like there aren't many cool hipster local places like this (hence all the great reviews) and the area is desperately craving something like this, but this place still just falls a little flat.  I've been in here at least 4 times and the service is really disappointing. Their cheeseburgers are not served with mayo and getting a side of mayo, or ranch is $1 each-- which tbh is kind of offensive. If you're going to pay for an expensive burger shouldn't the condiments be free?   The last time I came into Neighbors, I ordered a burger and when it arrived I had forgotten you had to buy the mayo-- so I went to the counter, paid the $1 for the mayo and waited. The short-haired woman told me they would bring it over and then proceeded to chat away with her co-worker pals. So I went to my seat and waited for well over 5 minutes (no mayo) while my burger got cold-- finally I went back up to the register and the woman said "Yes"? In a kind of snarky way and I said I'm still waiting on my mayo. She said " well it'll be out soon." To which I replied "I'd prefer to have it while my burger is still warm." She legit rolled her eyes at me and huffed that she had to be bothered to get the side of mayo herself. It's such a dumb, unnecessary interaction that sours the whole dining experience. When you're spending $40 on a lunch for 2, asking for friendly service really isn't too much to ask. (I felt annoyed and swindled that I actually tipped this woman 20% on my meal-- especially when it's not a "traditional" waitress position)  The cheeseburger (even with the mayo) is just a big meh; just another dry mediocre burger.  What IS good is their beet salad-- wholly moly is it dynamite! The beet salad with chicken never disappoints.  Pros: The beet salad- AMAZING          The ambiance is super cool           Cons: The wait-staff is rude            The prices are high            Condiments like ranch and mayo cost extra            They don't accept apple pay

xgNfXxLe7wBllUmSOgdqhA.text: So always on the lookout for new coffee spots or great breakfast/lunch spot for recovery meals. Neighbors is one that past by pretty often on workouts and always wanted to check out. I am really happy did because just might have found my new coffee spot!! It not only the lattes but the food and the fresh baked goodies are all delicious. The ones I had on two different occasions were very much on point!   My first visit came in for nice recovery lunch. I went with nice hearty filling sandwich. I ended up ordering the Chipotle Chicken Sandwich and also got blueberry muffin. It was amazing. Every component tasted fresh from the chicken, the fresh greens, onion, and few more items. The chipotle spread that took it up from not just plain jain sandwich but legit fresh sandwich. It nice size sandwich. Filling!!! The fries were nothing special but still they were nice and hot well seasoned. Definitely menu item would order again.  The blueberry muffin was tasty. One section off to the left of the counter has there fresh baked pastries. I like simple not huge selection. Each one on individual almost pastries stands or plate. Each one label so know without asking. The cinnamon rolls. I wanted to get one of those too. Just be overboard for just me. Lol. I ended up going with the blueberry muffin. The girl at counter got me sold even more telling me make pastries fresh everyday! It between small muffin and over the took big ones. I ended up eating it later that day. It was still one of the best muffins had in Vegas.  My second visit went with Matcha Latter and another blueberry muffin. It was the perfect compliment with my latte. Blueberry muffin was exactly the same feeling the first time. Really good blueberry muffin.   One thing should know is no table service you go up to the counter order, different they write your name rather then number that u take to a table, all the condiments and tap water you grab at the counter, and then someone drops food off at the table. I love the interior vibe all around. I all really nice wood table some long community tables. It would make sense with Neighbors and more open community of diners. I never been there full on packed. I could see it being loud cause all the table packed together. I love all the plants all round the restaurant. The service was five stars from everyone interacted with both times.   If looking for great breakfast/lunch spot off the strip Neighbors is winnah. I look forward to trying more of the menu.

Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle Chicken Sandwich and Blueberry Muffin
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3tFcPFTdtyfkSluCNXFYmA.text: Sorry to everyone who disagrees with my review... but to start, I was very excited to try this place out since so many people rave about it, but found myself to be disappointed.   Coming in, I wasn't expecting the restaurant to be in such a isolated commercialized area with a very interesting parking set up that led into the dirt for overflow parking. The line was quite long and the space was surprisingly huge! The ambiance is great and I can see why photos are all over everyone's Instagram. The main area to the right of the register was loud and bustling, but the other side was quite and calm, which is where we ended up sitting. I enjoy that Neighbors tries to be sustainable with their glass water cups and silverware.   I ordered the shakshuka and lavender latte with almond milk and my sister had the chicken chipotle sandwich with a raspberry lemonade. The shakshuka was good and flavorful with chilis that had some kick, but it is not something I would order again. The lavender latte was alright, nothing special. My sister was unimpressed with her food as well and we both found the menu to be overpriced in comparison to what we got.

4XNtP85w9e7bWoW5w1fuRQ.text: I love trying new breakfast/brunch places, and I recently discovered this place. We ordered the granola French toast and it's honestly one of the best I've had. Soooooo good. My husband got the Shakshuka, which was extremely tasty and delicious.   This is probably a place you don't want to hang out at too long, since you order then sit down. Seating was limited, but luckily something opened for us by the time we ordered. This place is definitely worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CYxMn_x-NSu09i_j2FR02A.text: This is an aesthetically pleasing brunch spot that I have been seeing often on Instagram. The food looked enticing but what seems to really draw people in is the coffee. I wasn't really feeling coffee that day but the lavender lemonade I ordered seemed like a great substitute. I liked how little lavender buds could be seen floating at the top of the drink.   The service is friendly and very quick. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. There was plenty of seating and each table seemed to have an aesthetic element on or around it.   We ordered the Shakshuka and Old School. Both were reasonably priced at $10 each and were very large portion sizes. The Shakshuka wasn't as spicy as I had thought but it did have some seeds that I had to skim for and take out. I chose to pair it with sourdough toast and it seemed like a match made in heaven. The eggs were poached well added more to the tomato flavor. The Old School had tons of potatoes stacked on top of the eggs and salad. The sausage wasn't too salty and had lots of flavor as well. It was an overall very filling breakfast with fresh ingredients paired with a nice ambiance. There's lots of parking too!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shakshuka with sourdough
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender lemonade
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Christmas interior decor

wb9ogOQZug_cX9vxXYPBvg.text: Great food at reasonable prices and great staff! Also very soothing atmosphere.. love this place!

V7rMZgNyqTBOYskjRA8O-Q.text: Neighbors is a quaint little fast casual restaurant where you order at the counter, grab your utensils and condiments, pick your seat, and employees bring you your food and drink. The decor is simple and the seats are hard wood without any padding. (Not the most comfortable for chillaxing)   The food and drinks are all pretty good. I love to order the frittata with feta instead of mozzarella so it's lighter and not so heavy. The red smashed potatoes are great, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The shakshuka is good if that's your thing (a little too tomato saucey for my taste). The avocado toast is decent, but not a lot of flavor. And the mocha latte is delicious especially since it isn't overly sweet like a lot of chocolate coffee drinks.   The service is mostly good although they do seem to have a constant turnover of their cashiers. My reason for not giving this place 5 stars is the restaurant cleanliness. It's very dusty and it's apparent the employees never clean or detail the condiment station. The amount of dirt and grime on just the salt and pepper shakers alone is horrific. It's sure to get a few dry heaves out of me when I think, "I wonder how dirty the kitchen where they prepare our food must be?"  I sure hope not because the food is good!    :-/

uzrNKPnBW_dOa-eu6tOG7w.text: Super cute and clean place! Food was great and drinks super delish. The only reason why I give it 4 stars because the veggie frittata I got was tasteless. Which was disappointing because my sister got the steak and eggs and we also got the coconut pancake to share. Both other dishes were bomb and full of flavors, dunno why my veggie frittata came out tasting like PAM - no exaggeration. Idk if the business had the chefs forgetting something but I wouldnt order this again if I came back - would come back doe

uwlSGTA3JC3uXIpvN9p8tw.text: The BEST.   Worked down the street and ate here at least once a week.  The whole menu is incredible.  Smoothies, salads, steak and eggs - you name it they've got it and it's delicious.    THIS IS A LOCK.  GREAT FOOD.

GwOG10ifVqc0INhyfTGhoA.text: This place is adorable for brunch dates!!! Bright and airy seating area with cute succulents at each table. It's a perfect combination of casual yet still very nice.  Large and simple menu. Big portions for a fair price. The shaksuka is yummy, but could use more spice. Smashed potatoes in their breakfast plate is perfectly cooked and well seasoned. Frittatas are large even though they're on the "light" menu. Delicious breakfast burritos! Will make an effort to visit here whenever I'm free for brunch

fqwJQbR68uNj7XNZ33E_8w.text: Food was amazing. It's a different way to experience breakfast. You order and seat yourself then they bring your food to you. The inside was super cute and open. We got the breakfast sandwich and steak and eggs, our son got the kids pancake and we left three very empty plates on the table. Seriously worth trying. Their food is spectacular. The flavor is amazing!!!! Thank you neighbors!  Sorry no photos........ we scarfed down our food.   I will add that the staff could smile a little more and be more friendly. Not overly friendly or over the top fake nice but just a little more welcoming.

hAJxQm4f5yFSjgqU2ecfNQ.text: My sister and I went a few days ago and I'm so glad we did! This place is extremely picturesque and welcoming. The food was absolutely amazing. My sister had the French toast and I had the grilled cheese that comes with tomato soup. Everything was very tasty and super fresh. All the staff was super attentive even though you have to walk up and order they still do a great job at making sure every one is doing well. The staff was really welcoming and friendly. Everything was great BUT the chai tea latte which tasted more like steamed milk rather than chai tea at all and also had about 2 1/2 inches of foam. Other than the latte which was -1/10, every thing was great! 10/10. I would recommend this to any and everyone in this neighborhood.

aEmeBc99m_CpBaI0sFoE7Q.text: 100% WORST Breakfast experience of my life!  I don't yelp bad stuff but this place seriously needs to read this and work on their management.  My over easy eggs were over hard, my med rare steak raw.  When they dropped off the food with no steak knife or Utensils we got up and got our own. No one ever came over to ask how everything was or said not 1 word to us on the way out bussed our table etc... No, "Thank you come again." Nothing!  This place is a disgrace to our service industry. I hope they fix it.

tkLQtvqOnH2saTCpZKjdZQ.text: First time stopping in, absolutely fantastic restaurant. Great food, amazing service, great prices. The atmosphere is light and fun and the decor is modern and bright.

LdC65It1K5FuKHW15Qp5CQ.text: Such a cute spot to have coffee! Amazing first impression walking in. The cafe is well decorated and filled with fun plants, gave me decorating Inspo! But besides how this place looks, the drinks and the food are really great. Good portions and fast service. I'm glad that there's a cool cafe on this side of town now. They open early enough to grab a quick treat before work! I've had a few of their lattes, but my favorite so far is the honey bee latte! Will definitely be back.

GFR0Rt_UZ48pJpC_AF8_VA.text: My friend and I try new breakfast spots every few weeks and this has definitely been my favorite so far! First, the set is is so adorable and efficient. You order at the counter and can help yourself to things like more water or coffee anytime. The food is amazing and has a unique twist on its items. The pricing is fair too! I'll definitely be back

WgVaeF4FqUuSxhuDxew6_w.text: Everything I've tried so far is great. Avocado toast is my fav thing.... This is my 5th time coming in and it's the same experience every time. Cool simple hipster vibes and always clean. The best part are the plants inside like the adorable succulents. I recommend this place if you're looking for something simple but good

kINR1pqizNT0o5avEPH2CA.text: Be careful. There are walnuts in the granola crunch on top of the French Toast in case you are allergic. It doesn't say that on the menu and they are hard to see at first. I'm not allergic, but I know of people that are. I e-mailed them to see if they can add this to their menu.   Otherwise,  I enjoyed it and the extra crunch it offered.

i7fEYwb6VROpVhdfe7j4ag.text: Got to go to the pre-opening with some friends and by golly this place is not only beautiful and inviting, but the food was so stinking fantastic. Their lavender latte and breakfast sandwich were ahhhmazing and the staff was very attentive and food came out fast. Please do yourself a solid and go to Neighbors and enjoy good company and great food!

E5xaAeHBppfhySGu05CxbQ.text: Overall ambiance is light and welcoming. You walk in and order and pay BEFORE you eat (and tip). Not thrilled being pressured to tip before having an opportunity to gauge the service.  You fill up your own water and grab your own condiments.  They really need to decide whether or not they are a casual or a "sit down" place. The mixed signals were overwhelming.  Good luck flagging down a waiter if you have questions or need something . I had to physically GET up after 5 minutes of trying to get one of the waiters attention.  Food is a 3/5. I had to send my streak back because it was SO rare when I had asked for medium.  Cappuccino was really good.  Overall, food was okay but I don't think I would return due to the service. Not impressed.

HXQ5yYdvIYQqfirejkrfRQ.text: This place is great! My coconut pancakes and Queen Bee latte were delicious! The pancakes were light and I didn't feel guilty about eating them. My boyfriend had the smoked salmon toast, and he ate every last bite! We will be back!

u-4AVfsVi_ccnDRxhNZkYQ.text: What a treat! Coming to visit from LA we joined our friends who now love and Vegas and are discovering new places often and this one was one of them. The decoration is rustic industrial. You order at the counter and they bring  your food to your table cantina style. Boy I was delicious! And the service is great! Amazing vegan  and vegetarian option. Will definitely come back! And definitely recommend!

cCqWViCatNQrbKff8d1BKg.text: I came in with my family because the menu looked good. We ordered the shakshuka the steak and eggs and the steak quesadilla. By tasting the shakshuka the chef never tasted this dish before making it. Basically it is tomato sauce and 2 small eggs and no seasoning  whatsoever. This dish should have vegetables cooked in the sauce with spices like cumin, paprika salt and pepper. The steak and eggs tasted bland even though they put a chimichuri sauce in top. Please season your food then you will get return client not just customers. I have more things to say but this has gone on long enough.

BWBXzeLcAIwUyJDcuPO-WQ.text: The food was excellent while the service that we received was not worth the value of the food. As you can see in the picture the restaurant is staffed way more than it needs and when you asked for something they told us that we would have to go get it instead of showing good customer service and grabbing it for us since they weren't doing anything else rather than talking to each other. Very disappointed with the service!

IxYIWOlkCu9PEcMsuYSLZA.text: Delicious way to start off the day! Had the French toast with a glass of their iced matcha on this visit. Both were really good and well presented. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant as well. Many more visits are planned for the near future.

7vSvCgwi-9wMYp2K8W1xnQ.text: Absolutely a wonderful environment & great food!! Check it out & enjoy!  We will be coming back for sure! Try the coffee!!

BnpO6yAK79vY_TRJ0WGDiQ.text: The lavender lemonade was phenomenal! Burger was great but the overnight oats was the winner!!!!

HS9t9pTqEfFZuZ_kEJ4WXA.text: Visiting from Maryland, decided to come here away from the strip. Staff was friendly, polite. Service was fast and food was delicious! Would definitely recommend this place!

g2IgW2STE-ecS7RItMhlpQ.text: Great atmosphere, amazing selection of quality food and coffee.  This new place is a must try!!! Breakfast sandwich and smashed potatoes are best in town.

ElP3WMG5YlCl3k6lMdDu_A.text: They were nice enough to invite the paramedics in their parking lot in for the soft open last week. The food was delicious, and I am a picky eater. The atmosphere, the decoration and the staff all top notch!  It's definitely a little gourmet flair to the traditional breakfast menu!   Will definitely be back. You should try it too!

cGf50e1HsaZ3UNy_45tVkA.text: This is a casual modern restaurant . Food is American bistro. Counter self-serve restaurant. Simple menu with healthy options. Prices are very reasonable for brunch. Good  for large group and family.

yOMihI4K8vkaGaGjLwtwMQ.text: I've been here about 4 times already within the past 2 weeks so that probably shows how much I enjoy this place! Lol It's always fun trying out a cute new brunch place in town, decorated with such a modern type feel with a whole wall of plants, white walls, and bistro bulb lighting to make the eating experience Instagram-worthy.   What keeps me coming back is the fact that their coffee is from Vesta Coffee Roasters, one of my favorite coffee shops in downtown! I'm obsessed with their white mocha latte and their lavender latte which are definite must tries!   Their food is delicious and comes in pretty big portions. I typically get "The Fun Guy" which is a meatless burger but is just as yummy filled with a grilled portobello mushroom, a fried eggplant Parmesan, arugula and balsamic aioli! The French toast is also a great choice for something more sweet than savory and will leave you feeling stuffed!  I do wish they had more variety of foods; it's pretty much just sandwiches, salads, and burgers so the menu is limited. They also only have one vegan option which is the avocado toast without the egg - a heads up to fellow vegan friends. Prices are somewhat fair due to the size that you're getting but do expect to spend at least $12+ on just one item.   It's an order at the cashier and seat yourself type place, making it a great choice to have a lunch with friends or a quick coffee pick me up. Service is great and definitely would recommend for your next brunch spot!

-ayDJw12-JH03IAbxff2LQ.text: Food was okay. The cashier was a bit inattentive. My biggest problem is that the corned beef smash I ordered was supposed to come with over easy eggs. They were WAAAAAY overcooked.

yaaVDOQYWVyWdUl7CbJYxA.text: I didn't actually eat here because it's so freaking LOUD!!   I came here with my family (3 adults, 2 kids and 2 teens) on a Sunday morning. We sat at a long table in the middle of the restaurant and could not hear each other. Literally couldn't hear the person right across from me. We ended up leaving. They need a sound barrier in here because every sound gets amplified.

ui4HIu1ARQJcTSVroNM0Ng.text: Neighbors is one of my favorite brunch spots in Vegas for sure. I attended their soft opening and everything was perfect. The place is ran as if they've been a seasoned business for years. The staff are always professional and friendly. The ambiance is casual, but interior decor is super hipster with neat plants everywhere. Very open, bright, and spacious.  The food is nothing short of amazing! I hate hate hate mushrooms but their mushroom burger is to die for. All of the lattes I have tried so far have yet to disappoint. And the salmon toast is one of my favorite things on the menu. Although I would recommend trying anything on the menu.  If I could give this place 6 stars, I would.

The decor is so relaxing to see that my daughter was calmed. I just love their plant wall! As soon as we walked in we got greeted and the cashier, Diana, helped us and recommended us the amazing lavander latte along with other items. We absolutely loved everything about this place.

1W3BQnCRRphvHLPfBOAlQg.text: This is such a cute place tucked into a complex near doctors and business offices. There is a big sign at the driveway, so you won't miss the turn. The inside looks like Joanna and Chip Gaines decorated; it is absolutely cute and inviting. You order your food and beverages at the register and they will deliver it to your table.   I had the breakfast burrito bowl and a white raspberry mocha. My friend ordered the breakfast sandwich with a salad, and Nutella latte. There is a seasonal menu as well as regular menu, and honestly all the food sounded amazing.   There is a pastry case that has a variety of really delicious looking items. The cinnamon rolls were very tempting, but I ended up not purchasing. We came early (8:30am) and it was not very busy, but it definitely picked up around 9:30-10am just before we left. This was a good place to have a tasty meal, yummy coffee, and converse without yelling. Next time I'll bring my family too. I recommend checking this place out!

3XqxZ05dphS12zmzelYenw.text: I absolutely love this place!! It's a counter walk-up and pay, no servers......Serve yourself silverware, condiments, and water station. And the food is delicious!! They also have a kids menu (which I havent seen anyone post about and of course didn't take a photo), but they do have one.

d8JTAHswUCdxuACyO-JMAw.text: Loved this place. It's got a beautiful airy decor with a greenhouse vibe. I think they make the best avocado toast in town and the service was great! It can be busy but most people eat and don't linger. They have a mint lemonade to try as well that's super refreshing. Another great gem in Vegas

f4BNo1f_ERC5iVqOcqiiMQ.text: Loved the food and  minimal decor of this place! Everything tasted fresh.   I order the smother salmon toast and it was delicious.   My husband ordered the breakfast burrito and it was just perfect    I will definitely be back

vzrtNUYifdevBpi7Rynn5A.text: Honestly, this place is hyped up. It's a beautiful brunch spot but it's not as good as I hoped for it to be. I got the AVO. It's pretty much with avocado toast with an egg on top, with a side salad. Something simple! I also ordered a fruit bowl- it cost $3. Not too bad. I think the best thing that I got was the lavender coffee. The lavender was subtle and not too overwhelming! It was slightly fragrant, but!!! The overall taste was amazing. I don't know about you but I love milky coffee.  Milky Not too sweet Sweet To sum it all up, this place sets a nice tone, the ambiance is great, the food is mediocre, their coffee is delicious, and your photos is this place will look stunning!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TQmHJg-ZInkb0IAnawBfAA.text: Today we enjoyed brunch with "Neighbors" ;-). The restaurant is literally set up like a cafeteria where you can share a meal and get to know your neighbors.   When you enter you are greeted and handed a menu to begin looking over. The line wraps right next to some delicious looking desserts and cookies. Once you order they give you a little metal tag to put on your table with your name. Very personable touch.   The wife chose the Shakshuka which is served in a skillet and comes with farm fresh eggs, sunny side up so you can break the yolk, tomato, bell peppers, feta cheese and fresno chilies. On the side of the plate you get 4 pieces of thinly sliced toast. Delicious meal and fun to scoop onto the bread with every bite. I decided on the Breakfast burrito this trip but almost went with the Old School breakfast. Both sounded good. The burrito was stuffed with sausage, smashed potatoes,a blend of cheeses and avocado crema. I had some sriracha mayo on the side which accompanied the burrito well and onions and diced tomatoes were sprinkled atop the plate. Definitely a 5/5 burrito. They give a 10% military discount and water is located next to the register; we made a couple trips to refill. I also ordered a sprite thinking it was a fountain drink but was delivered a can and glass with ice after inquiry a few times with the server. Next time just water or try to lemonade.  The place is new and popp'n, even if there are tons of people it'd be worth the wait. We have found a weekend brunch place to enjoy frequently!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito 5/5! Come hungry and get the side of sriracha mayo

anPhJk-qyqr1ygIq_F8VZg.text: I normally love this place, but this last visit was enough to not go again. I got the corned beef smash, which is a breakfast skillet with corned beef (obviously). First of all, it was INSANELY oily/greasy. As if that were not enough, the corned beef was little more than ALL FAT. For the price of this dish, I truly expected more. Lastly, not a single person came by and checked on us the entire duration of our visit - and while I understand they are normally very busy - this visit was very early and there was hardly anyone there. Even on their busiest days, we always had one or two people come by and check on us.  The level of disappointment I have after this trip is literally detouring me from going again. It's really sad, actually, because I truly did love this place. I just can't bring myself to spend such an amount on their food anymore. I almost feel like they've gotten too comfortable and don't care for their patrons anymore. Pity.

K9AFysF-dYGRQ63JaPCC-w.text: The place screams hipster all around! Aesthetically pleasing cafe. Plants, succulents, lighting, decor, etc everything in the cafe is my kind of thing. Friendly and helpful staff, for sure! Lost one star because of the flavor of the food. I wasn't wowed at all. However, presentation was nice! We ordered avo toast and shakshouka, sweet potato fries and fruit bowl for my little one. The side salad that came with the avo toast was nicely dressed! Very flavorful. The supposedly star of the dish (avo toast) wasn't everything. I've had better. The shakshouka was delicious! But I've had better. Wish it came with a few more slices of toast. The sweet potato fries was everything though. My son loved it! I'm definitely willing to come back to try other things on the menu like their drinks perhaps? We'll see.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_mp-ZwI2JHTihbW_GMDT4g.text: I didn't want to leave a review because I really wanted this place to remain a little secret. My favorite breakfast sandwich ever, and the queen bee latte with almond milk is heavenly! Love love love!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NzOrqcOTNhk4N62J3B5WaA.text: Just ordered delivery from them.  We ordered the Bacon Chipotle Burger.  I'm not sure how the most basic cooks cannot prepare a well done burger but these guys figured out a way!  I mean 'cmon...just cook the hell outta it.  Anyhow, the cooks here are obviously either busy or under-trained.  Aside from my burger coming medium instead of well done, all the toppings were stuck to one side (3 teeny tiny pickles).  The guy couldn't even spread the toppings evenly.  Burger was not well seasoned either.  The Chipotle mayo was pretty much non-existent and the bacon also under-cooked.  It gets 3 stars for arriving quickly and the decent fries.  Won't be eating here again.

rKSdI5-J_WgOUQkqeXtcvw.text: #1 Brunch Spot! Get the Lavender Latte!  It was so good, I went back and got a second cup in the same sitting.  I've never done that at a Cafe, ever!  The Mushroom burger was very good, especially with the Sweet Potato fries.  Everything was very good!  The atmosphere was energetic and lively.  The room was well lit and open, making the space feel huge.  It wasn't too noisy, but loud enough to know no one could really eavesdrop on your conversation, sort of the way that happens at parties.  The decor is gorgeous and almost ripped exactly from my Minimalist Pinterest Board.    There was plenty of parking as it is in a sort of office plaza, but not yet utilized by other businesses.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

iIsEZj2bsuwJn5HiQL0nhg.text: Love thy Neighbor's LV Cafe because their Shakshuka is my holy grail, but overall, their food is straight fire. Literal fire because the Shakshuka has way more of a chili kick than I was expecting. With a morning beverage menu fit for the gods, I recommend the matcha latte because my boyfriend was matcha green with envy that I wouldn't let him taste it.   Came here for breakfast with some co-workers and it was relatively busy for a Monday morning so I guess this is the spot to play hookey. You could call it a plant based restaurant since there are pots everywhere but the food is a mixture of millennial favorites such as avocado toast and gram worthy lattez. Cheers to 5 STARZ

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oMw80ZgOkHrilxC9_LFXxQ.text: I absolutely LOOOOVED this place!!! My friend and I always brunch on Thursdays and this place was such a treat!!   Everything we had was nothing short of amazing!! Not to mention - but totally worth mentioning - the place was adorable!   I'm slightly obsessed with lavender lattes rn so would you be surprised to know that is what I got here? You shouldn't be! And...I know I'm a yelper and all, but it was totally my first time having the cutesy design on top! It was marvelous btw.  My friend got some kind of Queen Bee latte. It was cinnamon-y and delightful as well.   I got some blueberry/lemon/coconut pancakes and I SWEAR I could've licked the plate clean because they were so amazing!  I will be back and I cannot WAIT to bring more people!!

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Latte with Queen Bee Latte (cold) - so so sooooo good!!
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Latte - I love you
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get these Coconut Pancakes!! Omggggg!!! So stinkin good!

nEHD6tHxCc0CdPfCiuFscQ.text: We love this place! We used to go weekly. Food is/was always delicious and service was good. Occasionally a dish would come out missing something but runners would correct it right away. They used to have a manager when they first opened who was very attentive but those days are long gone. I'm sure they have a manager now but who knows?   Our last experience on Saturday 9/21 was not as pleasant. We received our drinks but then waited 30 minutes for our food. One of us did receive our food but everybody else had to wait. After 25 minutes waiting we asked how much longer and no apologies, just another 5 minutes they said.   People who came after us had already received their food and we're leaving by the time our orders came out.  Unfortunately one of these dishes was for my kids, who again, had to watch and wait patiently.  By the end of our meal I regretted leaving a tip.  They have now expanded but it seems like they're struggling to keep with the pace of orders.   Tip to Neighbors: Bring a tables orders out at the same time, or kids first. At least apologize when orders are taking so long, or better yet tell people when they are ordering. "Sorry for the wait but we are serving our orders in 30 minutes."  Strive to give the best service, even when busy, and customers will keep coming back!  Tip to customers: If you go on a weekend make sure you have plenty of time and pack snacks ;)

c_bHuK8kJlnDJOhNFP4uDw.text: I really thought I would like this place a lot more. Great atmosphere, menu had plenty of interesting options, but overall it was just overpriced and not executed well.  Pros: Comfortable, rustic dining area with counter-ordering, seat yourself and then food service. Very clean and open atmosphere, and some of what we ordered was very tasty.  - sourdough is thick sliced and delicious - sausage is juicy and flavorful - salad is the savior of flavor!  Cons: For what we ordered it was overpriced, poorly executed, and honestly just odd in places.  - We ordered eggs on the side of the breakfast sandwich, and ended up with just a traditional breakfast plate that came to the table at least 5 minutes before anything else we ordered. Neither of us could figure out why the remaining ingredients (bacon, sausage, arugula, cheese, and chipotle mayo) couldn't have been served on a sandwich still. As it was they didn't include the mayo spread and we had to ask for it on the side still. - the avocado toast was just extremely underwhelming, which is odd since it's a simple dish to start with. The poached egg was so overcooked they may as well have just gone with hardboiled. There was so much avocado that the ratio was 1:1 with thick sliced bread, and it had no seasoning so it was overwhelming. I love avocado, but that's just too much without anything to cut through it. I opted to leave off tomatoes, but 3 small, sliced plain tomatoes wouldn't have saved this. What did save it was the side salad that had all the flavor after I scraped off about an entire avocados worth of spread in order to balance out the flavors.  It looked like the restaurant does a lot of coffees so maybe food just isn't really the focus of as go back again in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A &#34;poached&#34; egg on a 1:1 avocado/thick sliced bread with nowhere near enough seasoning to justify how much avo there was.
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The breakfast sandwich with egg on the side??
Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An entire side dish of avocado that fell of only half the toast. There had to have been 3 avocados worth on the 1 slice.

t6qofnTl65NhyXixEMEGPA.text: A neighborhood gem tucked away in a commercial park, Neighbors offers a healthy alternative to the daily grind. Good food, good prices and great customer service.  Only four stars because the cafeteria style accommodations makes for an incredibly noisy experience. I would come here more often if it wasn't for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PlWAAbjXyNMuujZhtv4Q7A.text: Foods good, tastes fresh, good size portions, clean and friendly atmosphere, I got an iced white mocha which I thought was amazing.  Definitely a great place for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Neighbors - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle chicken sandwich, burrito bowl, I ed white mocha, hot matcha latte

MhxkJ-DOIdjyqMaotITnGQ.text: This is an update to a previous two star review.  My wife had not been to the restaurant and wanted to see if things had changed since I had previously gone or if it was a one time thing.  I ordered the same Steak and Eggs, and this time I ordered the corn chowder to go with it.   I specifically asked for the soup as an appetizer. Not only was it served with my full meal, it was served 10 minutes after my wife got her meal. The corn chowder while flavorful was cold when it got to the table.  When looking at my main entree, I immediately realized that the major issue from my first review had not changed. The eggs were again lying in a pool of grease....more like floating on top of it! I also asked for the meat to be medium rare. It was pretty well done.  Due to the materials used for decorating the restaurant -- concrete, tile, etc, the room is quite loud and almost beyond being able to carry a conversation.   The meal cost $44.00 for Steak & Eggs, my wife's French Toast, corn chowder and two drinks. Too expensive for the meal as served.  This visit confirmed that I won't be returning.

YBPsBCl1yVYC5PgEZooEJQ.text: Just know what it is...   1- it's not a sit down!  2- no service (yes after you order they bring the food, BUT THATS IT) we asked for napkins and they told us to get up and get it our selves in the front.  3- very casual  Neighbors is like your friend started a restaurant, it doesn't feel like you're going out to eat. The food is ok but you can make it all at home   It's good and they have lots of options but just know what it is going   We liked it and would come back

It's a small space with hard floors everything echos much like a cafeteria I couldn't really hear my husband talking even right across the table. I wish there was room here for an outdoor patio area that way you could escape the noise.  Next, (not something you'll care about if you don't have young children) but there is no changing table in the restroom. Not good! The menu is a little all over the place and lots of sausage, bacon, cheese... things others love but not us.  My husband got the shakshuka and said it was good but very "American" he's Israeli and knows the difference lol! I got a seasonal salad bowl which was good the corn was fried or maybe grilled but it stuck to my teeth (not a good look) but tasted great! We both ordered the lavender mocha and that I must say was really good!
